story:
Thank you!

Thanks to everyone who donated in phase one of our campaign. We raised £3,340 which is magnificent and have set a target of £10,000 in total raised by the end of the year. Please help us by spreading the word! No donation is too small.

The young people we work with typically leave school with little or no prospects of employment or further education. Many have had years of difficulties in their home lives.

Without programmes like Against the Grain they often end up homeless, addicted or at worse with criminal convictions. 

Matt, George and John who are our first three trainees, say the project has already helped them gain knowledge of upholstery and finishing techniques, improved their confidence and taught them about working in teams. 

The programme has a positive impact on young people as well as a positive impact on our environment. By upcycling furniture we are helping to reduce landfill and restore things that have plenty more life in them yet.

What We Need & What You Get

The programme has received fantastic feedback so far.  We’ve had support from the community, including temporary premises, supplies, marketing and training.  However, without your help, our first group of young people will not be able to finish their training, or complete a portfolio of furniture that can sustain the enterprise. 

Funds raised will be used to:

  • Provide a modest income for young people to complete an 18-month programme
  • Provide tuition from experts
  • Pay for rented premises 
  • Pay for ongoing costs such as tools, materials, collections and deliveries

People willing to invest can receive regular reports on the progress of the project and the difference it is making to the young people engaged, by signing up here: info@makingthingsbetter.org.uk. 

Risks & Challenges

Funding for projects like these has become harder to come by, which is why we are now seeking support from individuals in the community too. 

Your investment has no financial return, but we can guarantee that it will have an impact on the quality of life and future prospects for our young people. We are experienced and qualified in  our field and know what it takes to get young people ready for the world of work.  

Other Ways You Can Help

No donation is too small, but if you are not able to donate money we  also welcome donations of materials, furniture, equipment or training. If you are a skilled trades person who would like to teach our young people new skills, we would love to hear from you. If you have unwanted pieces of furniture or want to commission our team to refurbish an item for you, please get in touch. 

How it all began

Against the Grain is the brainchild of Katharine Horler who has worked with young people at risk across the Thames Valley for many years. Her passion is to raise their aspirations by building confidence and teaching life and work skills, ultimately securing them permanent employment and a brighter future. 

Katharine, who is CEO of Thames Valley charity Adviza. believes passionately in Against the Grain and convinced her trustees to invest in its initial development.  With a small, dedicated team, she has used funding to establish a programme to teach furniture restoration and small business management skills, and three young people are currently creating the first new products to sell.  

The strength of the community 

We believe in the strength of community to create much needed chances for these young people. At a time when funding for charitable organisations is critically low, we ask for our community’s support to help sustain what we have started. 

Let’s empower our young people to build up their confidence, skills, and portfolio of restored furniture so that they can make Against the Grain a success.
story_txt:
Thank you!Thanks to everyone who donated in phase one of our campaign. We raised £3,340 which is magnificent and have set a target of £10,000 in total raised by the end of the year. Please help us by spreading the word! No donation is too small.The young people we work with typically leave school with little or no prospects of employment or further education. Many have had years of difficulties in their home lives.Without programmes like Against the Grain they often end up homeless, addicted or at worse with criminal convictions. Matt, George and John who are our first three trainees, say the project has already helped them gain knowledge of upholstery and finishing techniques, improved their confidence and taught them about working in teams. The programme has a positive impact on young people as well as a positive impact on our environment. By upcycling furniture we are helping to reduce landfill and restore things that have plenty more life in them yet.What We Need & What You GetThe programme has received fantastic feedback so far.  We’ve had support from the community, including temporary premises, supplies, marketing and training.  However, without your help, our first group of young people will not be able to finish their training, or complete a portfolio of furniture that can sustain the enterprise. Funds raised will be used to:
Provide a modest income for young people to complete an 18-month programme
Provide tuition from experts
Pay for rented premises 
Pay for ongoing costs such as tools, materials, collections and deliveries
People willing to invest can receive regular reports on the progress of the project and the difference it is making to the young people engaged, by signing up here: info@makingthingsbetter.org.uk. Risks & ChallengesFunding for projects like these has become harder to come by, which is why we are now seeking support from individuals in the community too. Your investment has no financial return, but we can guarantee that it will have an impact on the quality of life and future prospects for our young people. We are experienced and qualified in  our field and know what it takes to get young people ready for the world of work.  Other Ways You Can HelpNo donation is too small, but if you are not able to donate money we  also welcome donations of materials, furniture, equipment or training. If you are a skilled trades person who would like to teach our young people new skills, we would love to hear from you. If you have unwanted pieces of furniture or want to commission our team to refurbish an item for you, please get in touch. How it all beganAgainst the Grain is the brainchild of Katharine Horler who has worked with young people at risk across the Thames Valley for many years. Her passion is to raise their aspirations by building confidence and teaching life and work skills, ultimately securing them permanent employment and a brighter future. Katharine, who is CEO of Thames Valley charity Adviza. believes passionately in Against the Grain and convinced her trustees to invest in its initial development.  With a small, dedicated team, she has used funding to establish a programme to teach furniture restoration and small business management skills, and three young people are currently creating the first new products to sell.  The strength of the community We believe in the strength of community to create much needed chances for these young people. At a time when funding for charitable organisations is critically low, we ask for our community’s support to help sustain what we have started. Let’s empower our young people to build up their confidence, skills, and portfolio of restored furniture so that they can make Against the Grain a success.

story: As I take the next step towards my goal of being the best franchise in the industry I have to take a moment to reflect on what brought me here. Years of being in the business I have watched companies fail to exercise persistent quality in a top of line format. Hair has been the biggest and most influential thing in the African American Community and there is no room for mediocracy. I have had the opportunity of working alongside military personnel, chefs, pilots, athletes, celebrities, mothers, fathers, and children. Nonetheless each individual deserves top of line service and I have a vision to offer it unlike any others. This vision will take time and a lot of support to get up and running, I am proud to say I have taken the first step with my new location. We have started the building and set up for barbers, cosmetologists, and all walks of like who take pride in their craft and work. I am blessed beyond belief and love what hair has done for my family, my life, and my people! I look to pass on a portion of these proceeds to charity to help families in any way I can! I appreciate anyone and everyone who has ever supported or helped! Thank You!!

story:
Here is a a sample of one of the big ice blocks that fell from the sky picked up 10 hours after the storm.

This hail happened in  a small village in shinyanga region Tanzania.It killed 30 people and  left 60 injured and others homeless.You can watch the video embeded in my account.
I'm  Margreth Michael ,the C.E.O of Umoja na Nguvu Women's NGO.We sent 200kilos of food and almost  9000$ to repair the damaged and wrecked residences.
This contribution will be sent to the local people of Mwakita to help them do repair and meet their basic needs because most of  properties were destroyed.
PLEASE NOTE THAT ALL CONTRIBUTIONS ARE TO BE SENT TO THE PROJECT COORDINATOR ACCOUNT,


The contributon is essential for saving these peoples lives.
YOU CAN ALSO CONTRIBUTE BY SENDING FOOD AND CONSTRUCTION MATERIALS TO THIS REGION.Please send us your request at Umojananguvu@live.com THANK YOU

story:
Short Summary

Hai, I am Swetha Shenoy, a person who loves to help people. I have been working for the past 5 years in the Environment Industry and realized one major fact: not everyone has access to safe water. I am starting this campaign because i want to provide safe drinking water to 10 poor families in Hyderabad, India. These families suffer because they donot have save water. Most of the diseases are caused by contaminated water and these people cannot afford even 1 liter of pure water.

What We Need & What You Get

We require USD 500 For the following reasons 

1. Adoption of 1 family of 5 members- USD 50

Hence adoption of 10 families of 5 members- USD 500

What the families get: Everyday they will get 20 liters of safe water. Per person is entitled to get 3 liters of water per day. They will get one 20 liters can for the same 

What you get:

An opportunity to interact with the families adopted(via skype/personal visit), their pictures after receiving the water and a thank you letter handwritten by them

The Impact

The families are poor as their daily earnings is less than USD 5. They cannot afford to buy even 1 liter of water which is very costly. With provision of pure and safe drinking water, they will have a new way of life. The women in the families can save their time in doing other works other than travelling miles to fetch water. Their health will be improved. When their health is improved, even their standard of living also improves and manhours lost due to water borne diseases will reduce 

Risks & Challenges

I know that it is very difficult to provide them safe water, but the following will be done 

1. Awareness regarding the safe water will be informed to them

2. I will be collaborating with a company called 'Smaat India Private Limited' who are water providers as they will update me on daily basis on the funding 

Please share/contribute to help these people have a better way of life.

I would appreciate if you could donate for this cause. Your contribution would change someone's life! To you it might not be much, but to them it could mean a lot!

story:
Hello to everybody!


My name is Sergey Kamburov and not long ago I lived and ran a small business in Ukraine. However as you may know the present situation in Ukraine is not favorable not only for business but for normal life itself. My home country has been affected by military conflict. The political situation is complicated and the economy is in crisis. So I had to shut down my business which was a small video gaming club where I invested not just my savings but my enthusiasm and plans for a better future.

In search of new opportunities to set up my life I moved to Bulgaria – a small but nice and hospitable European country at the Black Sea coast.

Here, in the city of Sofia, I decided to start up the same business enterprise.

I’d like to start a small gaming club where people will be able to play the latest console games, to share their passion for gaming with friends, to relax in cozy atmosphere, to have a couple of beers or just coffee and fresh and generally have good time and fun  like it was in my place back in Ukraine.

I have experience, a detailed business plan, strong personal motivation and I can count on the support of some Bulgarian friends here. So the only ingredient missing in the recipe for success of this enterprise is the starting capital. I hope to get your support and bring my business idea into life. Together we can make X-Play go!

Thank you and let all your dreams come true!


What I Need Your Support For

Type of Expense Quantity Approximate Price (USD) Total (USD)
       
Reconstruction works   4000 4000
6 months rent 6 800 4600
Ultra HD TV sets 5 1300 6500
Video gaming projector 1 2000 2000
Latest consoles (Xbox One and PS4) 5 400 2000
Latest Top Games for Xbox One and PS4 50 70 3500
Nice and stable tablеs 8 100 800
Cozy sofas 8 500 4000
Gamepads and equipment 20 60 1200
Snacks & Beverages ... ... 3000
Cool website 1 2500 2500
       
Expected expenses total     34100


Video from my previous gaming club back in Ukraine



Let's spread the word

You may also help me spread the word. Just share X-Play campaign with all your friends and followers on the social networks and kindly ask them to do the same.


Awesome givaways are waiting for you

Awesome perks are waiting for the X-Play campaign supporters such as branded badges, coffee mugs, T-shirts, hoodies, caps, google glasses, game controllers etc.



The most generous donators are invited to visit me and spend an exciting week in Bulgaria as my personal guests. Accomodation and guided tours to intriguing tourist sites, clubs and restaurants will be provided. Airplane tickets and other travel costs and expenses are NOT included. This is NOT a regular tourist service but a personal visit invitation. Time of visit is to be specified additionally after IndieGoGo campaign ends.



Credits

This campaign has been realized thanks to the combined efforts of our super hero team:

story:
Our family business is a dream come true...with your help, we can grow it! 

Hi! My name is Lauren and I've converted my childhood home to a pretty amazing 'lil venue. PointBreezeway was born circa 1880 as a utility barn and has since housed families, a tavern (then speakeasy!), a tearoom, and a confectionary. 

We host anything from homestyle weddings, showers and rehearsal dinners to business retreats, networking events, benefits and cast parties! In addition, we proudly open our doors to local musicians, chefs, dancers and performers of all kinds!  

The response to PointBreezeway has been incredible! I’m so excited to share the stories and the beauty of our space with everyone I can. My goal is to preserve the history of the building and to continue to create a thriving family business. My dad still lives upstairs (we've been here for 25 years)…a true family affair! 

Opening my home, in this way, is the best thing I have ever done.

Note: while going through the donation process a screen will show up that says "Payment Summary" you have to click "continue" on the right side of the screen in order for the donation to actually process.

Here's where YOU come in!

The PointBreezeway Patio Project is all about optimization! 

1. We need the ability to seat more people = building a deck. 

2. We need coverage that can handle the (Pittsburgh..double yoi) weather = building a structure off of the house that is able to be enclosed with a heater for the cold months and when it rains. 

3. We need proper access into the building = incorporating ramps that are to code. 

We are asking for $10,000 to help us transform our patio into a functional and absolutely necessary improvement to our business.  

Why this is so important to us?

As a small venue we can only accommodate so many guests..comfortably. Your support allows us to:
1. Offer a beautiful and functional patio (that could once seat maybe 20 people--weather pending) to a patio that can seat up to 40! This is HUGE for a small venue like ours. The more people we can seat...the more events we can host. And guess what! We won't have to worry about the patio flooding anymore. 
2.  Rent the space in the cold, Pittsburgh months. Our average guest list is about 50 people...that's too many for us to host inside. Building a structure that we can enclose and heat in the winter time gives us the ability to offer more space = business growth! Yay!!! 
3. This project is going to look AMAZING! Our patio sits on the side of the house on Reynolds Street. What an improvement this will be to the facade! You'll be able to see it each time you drive by...it will stand so proud! If you host a special moment or gathering here...you will be filled with delight! 
4. Most importantly...a new chapter will be added to our story. This improvement will allow our community to continue to gather with family and friends right here in their own backyard...right here at PointBreezeway. 
But wait! There's more...
This project sets us up for The PointBreezeway Overlook! 
Picture this: the ceiling of the structure we build for the Patio Project will act as the floor of the deck we want to build around the second story of the house. 
PointBreezeway will be the home of the only birds eye view of Frick Park from a residential neighborhood! You will have a new space to be completely inspired. 

No money? No problem!

If you can't donate any money to our campaign - we understand. All we ask is that you share this page with your friends, family, pets, boss, neighbors, and every stranger you encounter. 

PointBreezeway will always be Pittsburgh's sweetheart for gatherings..100 years down and 100 more to go.

Note: while going through the payment process a screen will show up that says "Payment Summary" you have to click "continue" on the right side of the screen in order for the payment to actually process.

story:
Amendment IV

"The right of the people to be secure in their persons, houses, papers, and effects, against unreasonable searches and seizures, shall not be violated, and no warrants shall issue, but upon probable cause, supported by oath or affirmation, and particularly describing the place to be searched, and the persons or things to be seized."   Ref: http://constitution.findlaw.com/amendment4.html

Equal protection clause of the 14th amendment.

"The Equal Protection Clause is part of the Fourteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution. Many view it as the attempt to uphold the professed “all men are created equal” clause written in the Constitution. The Equal protection law implies that no State has the right to deny anyone within jurisdiction equal protection of the law." Ref:  http://constitution.laws.com/equal-protection-clause

The following Supreme Court of the United States addresses an near identical property situation that was decided in favor of the property owner. We intend to use this decision to defeat the sewage mandate in Johnstown.

U.S. Supreme Court

Camara v. Municipal Court, 387 U.S. 523 (1967)

Camara v. Municipal Court of the City and County of San Francisco

No. 92

Argued February 15, 1967

Decided June 5, 1967

387 U.S. 523

APPEAL FROM THE DISTRICT COURT OF APPEAL OF CALIFORNIA,

FIRST APPELLATE DISTRICT

Syllabus

Appellant was charged with violating the San Francisco Housing Code for refusing, after three efforts by city housing inspectors to secure his consent, to allow a warrantless inspection of the ground-floor quarters which he leased and residential use of which allegedly violated the apartment building's occupancy permit. Claiming the inspection ordinance unconstitutional for failure to require a warrant for inspections, appellant while awaiting trial, sued in a State Superior Court for a writ of prohibition, which the court denied. Relying on Frank v. Maryland, 359 U. S. 360, and similar cases, the District Court of Appeal affirmed, holding that the ordinance did not violate the Fourth Amendment. The State Supreme Court denied a petition for hearing.

Held:

1. The Fourth Amendment bars prosecution of a person who has refused to permit a warrantless code enforcement inspection of his personal residence. Frank v. Maryland, supra, pro tanto overruled. Pp. 387 U. S. 528-534.

(a) The basic purpose of the Fourth Amendment, which is enforceable against the States through the Fourteenth, through its prohibition of "unreasonable" searches and seizures is to safeguard the privacy and security of individuals against arbitrary invasions by governmental officials. P. 387 U. S. 528.

(b) With certain carefully defined exceptions, an unconsented warrantless search of private property is "unreasonable." Pp. 387 U. S. 528-529.

(c) Contrary to the assumption of Frank v. Maryland, supra, Fourth Amendment interests are not merely "peripheral" where municipal fire, health, and housing inspection programs are involved whose purpose is to determine the existence of physical conditions not complying with local ordinances. Those programs, moreover, are enforceable by criminal process, as is refusal to allow an inspection. Pp. 387 U. S. 529-531.

(d) Warrantless administrative searches cannot be justified on the grounds that they make minimal demands on occupants;

Page 387 U. S. 524

that warrant in such cases are unfeasible; or that area inspection programs could not function under reasonable search warrant requirements. Pp. 387 U. S. 531-533.

2. Probable cause upon the basis of which warrants are to be issued for area code enforcement inspections is not dependent on the inspector's belief that a particular dwelling violates the code, but on the reasonableness of the enforcement agency's appraisal of conditions in the area as a whole. The standards to guide the magistrate in the issuance of such search warrants will necessarily vary with the municipal program being enforced. Pp. 387 U. S. 534-539.

3. Search warrants which are required in nonemergency situations should normally be sought only after entry is refused. Pp. 387 U. S. 539-540.

4. In the nonemergency situation here, appellant had a right to insist that the inspectors obtain a search warrant. P. 387 U. S. 540.

237 Cal.App.2d 128, 46 Cal.Rptr. 585, vacated and remanded. https://supreme.justia.com/cases/federal/us/387/523/case.html


42 U.S. Code § 1983 - Civil action for deprivation of rights

Every person who, under color of any statute, ordinance, regulation, custom, or usage, of any State or Territory or the District of Columbia, subjects, or causes to be subjected, any citizen of the United States or other person within the jurisdiction thereof to the deprivation of any rights, privileges, or immunities secured by the Constitution and laws, shall be liable to the party injured in an action at law, suit in equity, or other proper proceeding for redress, except that in any action brought against a judicial officer for an act or omission taken in such officer’s judicial capacity, injunctive relief shall not be granted unless a declaratory decree was violated or declaratory relief was unavailable. For the purposes of this section, any Act of Congress applicable exclusively to the District of Columbia shall be considered to be a statute of the District of Columbia.

(R.S. § 1979; Pub. L. 96–170, § 1, Dec. 29, 1979, 93 Stat. 1284; Pub. L. 104–317, title III, § 309(c), Oct. 19, 1996, 110 Stat. 3853.)


This issue affects everyone whose sewage runs into the Johnstown Regional sewage system. The Westmont example that follows can be applied to all properties that are under this mandate.

The Westmont ordinance.

On May 1, 2015, the Westmont Borough council members began requiring all homeowners to upgrade their private sewage lines in order to prevent ground water from entering the public sewage lines. Currently their ordinance prevents owners from selling their homes by making it unlawful to transfer a title before a compliance test has been satisfied.  Eventually this mandate will extend to all homeowners even if they are not selling their homes.

This ordinance could cost you thousands if not, tens of thousands of dollars to comply. The net effect on your property values is that it will further erode your investment into your home.

My attorneys inform me that the ordinance is an unconstitutional intrusion into your privacy and violates the equal protection clause of the U.S. Constitution and therefore legally unenforceable, yet some home owners are submitting to the mandate to just get out of the Borough. When challenged the Westmont Borough Council members have simply refuse to listen to their constitutions and reverse their mandate.

I am prepared to spearhead a legal challenge in Federal Court to block the mandate on constitutional grounds, but I need your help.

We need to raise a minimum of $10,000 to retain counsel to undertake this campaign. Your contributions will not be accepted unless we reach our goal. There is no risk to donate.

Please consider supporting this cause to save our community from excessive government intrusion into our home investments.

Thanks and best regards,

Doc
story_txt:
Amendment IV

"The
 right of the people to be secure in their persons, houses, papers, and 
effects, against unreasonable searches and seizures, shall not be 
violated, and no warrants shall issue, but upon probable cause, 
supported by oath or affirmation, and particularly describing the place 
to be searched, and the persons or things to be seized."   Ref: http://constitution.findlaw.com/amendment4.html
Equal protection clause of the 14th amendment.







"The Equal Protection Clause is part of the Fourteenth Amendment to the 
United States Constitution. Many view it as the attempt to uphold the 
professed “all men are created equal” clause written in the 
Constitution. The Equal protection law implies that no State has the 
right to deny anyone within jurisdiction equal protection of the law." Ref:  http://constitution.laws.com/equal-protection-clauseThe following Supreme Court of the United States addresses an near identical property situation that was decided in favor of the property owner. We intend to use this decision to defeat the sewage mandate in Johnstown.U.S. Supreme CourtCamara v. Municipal Court, 387 U.S.  523 (1967)Camara v. Municipal Court of the City and County of San FranciscoNo. 92Argued February 15, 1967Decided June 5, 1967387 U.S. 523APPEAL FROM THE DISTRICT COURT OF APPEAL OF CALIFORNIA,

FIRST APPELLATE DISTRICT

Syllabus

Appellant was charged with violating the San Francisco Housing Code 
for refusing, after three efforts by city housing inspectors to secure 
his consent, to allow a warrantless inspection of the ground-floor 
quarters which he leased and residential use of which allegedly violated
 the apartment building's occupancy permit.  Claiming the inspection 
ordinance unconstitutional for failure to require a warrant for 
inspections, appellant while awaiting trial, sued in a State Superior 
Court for a writ of prohibition, which the court denied.  Relying on Frank v. Maryland, 359 U. S. 360,
 and similar cases, the District Court of Appeal affirmed, holding that 
the ordinance did not violate the Fourth Amendment.  The State Supreme 
Court denied a petition for hearing.
Held:
1. The Fourth Amendment bars prosecution of a person who has refused 
to permit a warrantless code enforcement inspection of his personal 
residence.  Frank v. Maryland, supra, pro tanto overruled.  Pp.  387 U. S. 528-534.
(a) The basic purpose of the Fourth Amendment, which is enforceable 
against the States through the Fourteenth, through its prohibition of 
"unreasonable" searches and seizures is to safeguard the privacy and 
security of individuals against arbitrary invasions by governmental 
officials.  P.  387 U. S. 528.
(b) With certain carefully defined exceptions, an unconsented warrantless search of private property is "unreasonable."  Pp.  387 U. S. 528-529.
(c) Contrary to the assumption of Frank v. Maryland, supra, 
Fourth Amendment interests are not merely "peripheral" where municipal 
fire, health, and housing inspection programs are involved whose purpose
 is to determine the existence of physical conditions not complying with
 local ordinances.  Those programs, moreover, are enforceable by 
criminal process, as is refusal to allow an inspection.  Pp.  387 U. S. 529-531.
(d) Warrantless administrative searches cannot be justified on the grounds that they make minimal demands on occupants; Page 387 U. S. 524
 that warrant in such cases are unfeasible; or that area inspection 
programs could not function under reasonable search warrant 
requirements.  Pp.  387 U. S. 531-533.
2. Probable cause upon the basis of which warrants are to be issued 
for area code enforcement inspections is not dependent on the 
inspector's belief that a particular dwelling violates the code, but on 
the reasonableness of the enforcement agency's appraisal of conditions 
in the area as a whole.  The standards to guide the magistrate in the 
issuance of such search warrants will necessarily vary with the 
municipal program being enforced.  Pp.  387 U. S. 534-539.
3. Search warrants which are required in nonemergency situations should normally be sought only after entry is refused.  Pp.  387 U. S. 539-540.
4. In the nonemergency situation here, appellant had a right to insist that the inspectors obtain a search warrant.  P.  387 U. S. 540.
237 Cal.App.2d 128, 46 Cal.Rptr. 585, vacated and remanded. https://supreme.justia.com/cases/federal/us/387/523/case.html42 U.S. Code § 1983 - Civil action for deprivation of rights
                  
            
      	  
                        
        
			
			
      

  Every person who, under color of any statute, 
ordinance, regulation, custom, or usage, of any State or Territory or 
the District of Columbia, subjects, or causes to be subjected, any 
citizen of the United States or other person within the jurisdiction 
thereof to the deprivation of any rights, privileges, or immunities 
secured by the Constitution and laws, shall be liable to the party 
injured in an action at law, suit in equity, or other proper proceeding 
for redress, except that in any action brought against a judicial 
officer for an act or omission taken in such officer’s judicial 
capacity, injunctive relief shall not be granted unless a declaratory 
decree was violated or declaratory relief was unavailable. For the 
purposes of this section, any Act of Congress applicable exclusively to 
the District of Columbia shall be considered to be a statute of the 
District of Columbia.
                
                (R.S. § 1979; Pub. L. 96–170, § 1, Dec. 29, 1979, 93 Stat. 1284; Pub. L. 104–317, title III, § 309(c), Oct. 19, 1996, 110 Stat. 3853.)This issue affects everyone whose sewage runs into the Johnstown Regional sewage system. The Westmont example that follows can be applied to all properties that are under this mandate.The Westmont ordinance.On May 1, 2015, the Westmont Borough council members began requiring all homeowners to upgrade their private sewage lines in order to prevent ground water from entering the public sewage lines. Currently their ordinance prevents owners from selling their homes by making it unlawful to transfer a title before a compliance test has been satisfied.  Eventually this mandate will extend to all homeowners even if they are not selling their homes. This ordinance could cost you thousands if not, tens of thousands of dollars to comply. The net effect on your property values is that it will further erode your investment into your home. My attorneys inform me that the ordinance is an unconstitutional intrusion into your privacy and violates the equal protection clause of the U.S. Constitution and therefore legally unenforceable, yet some home owners are submitting to the mandate to just get out of the Borough. When challenged the Westmont Borough Council members have simply refuse to listen to their constitutions and reverse their mandate. I am prepared to spearhead a legal challenge in Federal Court to block the mandate on constitutional grounds, but I need your help.We need to raise a minimum of $10,000 to retain counsel to undertake this campaign. Your contributions will not be accepted unless we reach our goal. There is no risk to donate. Please consider supporting this cause to save our community from excessive government intrusion into our home investments.Thanks and best regards,Doc

story:
EVERY ONE OF US HAS A FEW THINGS THAT WE REALLY DON’T WANT TO RUN OUT OF...



SmartQsine™ takes care of whatever you decide that needs to be monitored, and does the job for you, giving you the information only when you really need it!


                     HOW IT WORKS
The system is made of a Pad, and an associated Smartphone/Tablet application.
The first time you will use the Pad, you just need to place on it the item that you want to monitor, set its current level, and…just forget it!
  

              


From now on, the Pad will start talking to your mobile, exchanging the information on the quantity of the good placed on it, silently, without you even noticing it.

  • When you are shopping, or arriving home, is when you really need to know that data. You take your mobile, and see for yourself if something needs to be bought or not.
  •  You can make your life even easier, by setting an alarm that will alert you when something is below a certain level. The alarm can be set for a specific time, or for when you approach a certain location (like your home or shop).
  •  You can have the application send a message to a person of your choice (your partner, your trusted grocery store guy right around the corner), when something is almost finished, and he or she will bring it to you.
  •  You can easily edit your shopping list, and be sure that the things that really matter to you are always available.

Or

You have a small shop, and you don’t want to spend all your day running through the corridors, to be sure that the pantries are always kept full.

Well…You can monitor them…just from your desk. And you will know when you need to refill.

There are endless scenarios, and indeed you, the user, will surely have your own special needs and ways to exploit the capabilities of the system.

 

                            MORE

Here are few things you need to know to assess if SmartQsine™ is suitable for your needs:

  • The Pad is as thin as possible. It is not going to be another bulky gadget in your home.
  • The associated app is made to be as streamlined as possible, although very flexible. It has been developed with the idea that it will do its work in the background, without bothering you and with minimal effort. It will do the job for you.
  • The same app will monitor several pads, thus allowing you to take care of all your items in a central, user friendly environment.

                        FLAVOURS

To allow the user to save costs, we have developed 2 lines of Pads: Gold Pad, and Silver Pad

The Gold Pad has the capability to communicate with the mobile application, and to monitor not only what the user places on it, but also to acquire the data coming from several other Pads linked to it.

The Silver Pad doesn’t have communication capabilities, thus allowing it to be much cheaper than the Gold one. Once a Silver Pad is physically linked to a Gold Pad, it will be seen by the mobile application as a new independent Pad, with all the required features of the Gold model.

This means that, if a user wants to monitor multiple goods, she/he can purchase several Gold Pads, or just one Gold Pad, and several Silver ones to accomplish the same task.


                      


                  CUSTOMIZATIONS


We know that everybody has different needs. If milk is a good example of something that many of us never want to run out, it is clear to us that we needed to provide a solution able to get close to the requirements of most of the people or businesses.

That’s why we made things so flexible!

We can easily modify the Pad and the features of the mobile application, in order to fit with your special requirements.


                TALKING ABOUT US




   WHY WE ASK FOR YOUR SUPPORT

We need to go into production, and produce around 2500 pads in order to make them cost effective.

Moreover, we want to go beyond it... expanding devices' capabilities, its usage contexts, and the services that we can provide along with the application, which are too many to be developed in advance.


How you can help:


                                                   REFERRAL PROGRAM



More ways to help...

Spread your voice! Tell as many people as possibile about SmartQsine

"Like us" on Facebook, "Follow" us on Twitter, participate, and suggest new ideas and applications. 

We are hungry for customizations. If you see a particular application suitable for our system, please share it with us, and tell them about us. We can easily adapt the system for plenty of scenarios. The electronics are there, the application too... We would just need to modify the pads !


What if....

Tooling Costs are always a huge barrier...

If we reach $ 150.000, we will add this perk too: a multi Pad able to monitor 4 items at a time.

                                             

The Electronic and the Application are ready (they are actually the same as per the single Pads already developed). We would just would need to cover the Non Recurring Cost required to start the production

                     OUR JOURNEY





As for many cases, the idea came for everyday life.

Uriel has two children, and all too often realized too late that the milk would not be enough for tomorrow morning's breakfast.
While thinking on a way to be advised before actually approaching home, we realized that a system able to solve this issue, would also solve many other similar issues, and be useful in several scenarios and applications, not only in the consumer market, but also the small business environment (think about a bar, a small restaurant...)
It was February 2014
In two months, we prepared all the papers to validate the idea (Business Model Canvas, Business Plan, a maximalized architecture), selected and built the right  team, patented the system, and started the development.

June 2014:
We patented the system, the brand "SmartQsine", and started the company that manages all.
We realized our first firmware using using ARM® mbed™ during the development stage to make it easy to prove the concept is viable, and a demo application running on Android and iOS. 
Everything was very ugly...but functioning



September 2014

While moving forward on the Software side, we also began developing our own first PCB, and started seeing how the pad would look like



November 2014

Finally...the product was ready!
Android application fully developed, a new PCB board, Firmware optimized, mechanical interface and case finalized!


                                                    


So, we decided to go to CES2015....

January 2015

A very small batch of pads were realized, and the application consolidated. The system was introduced for the first time to the public, at CES 2015. 


                                    


Immediatelyafter returning from CES, we were invited by the Italian National Broadcasting TV, to show it live.




February 2015

New features have been implemented, bug fixing was in process and we had several rounds to find the best way and right manufacturers for the mass production.

ARM people came to know that we have been using  mbed™ during the development process. They invited us at their headquarters in Cambridge, tested and shot the Catering Scenario, and placed a Gold Pad in their demo room (where it still is).


                                         
March 2015

Started preparing the crowdfunding campaign, and attended another exhibition, this time, in Milan, called "Seeds & Chips".


          


                   MAIN FEATURES

                                                               PADS

                                                           ---------------------------

                                                         APPLICATION


                                           Background Synchronization

                                            Family/Group Data Sharing

                                              Time based notifications

                          Notifications automatically sent  to third parties



                                                                   --------------------

   -                                                           

                                                                   ---------------------




                                  FAQ

How are the Pads Powered?

The Pads are powered by a standard coin battery (CR2032). It lasts for about 6 months and can be easily replaced once it runs out.

How do I know when the battery is running out?

Nothing should ever run out in the SmartQsine world....

An alert will show up at the Pad tab on the application, to alert you that the battery is almost over.

How many Pads can the application manage?

No Limit

Why BLE?

The system, as you see it now, and as you will receive it, is based on Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) technology.

We decided to go in this direction for mainly two reasons:

  1. Power. Using BLE we can provide a product whose battery lasts for 6 months.
  2. BLE is now present in every new phone and smartphone, thus allowing the user to exploit what is already at hand.

Using WiFi would have enabled the user to directly connect to the pads from the street. However, it would have been too power consuming, and we didn't want the user to change the battery or recharge it every week.

Z-Wave, by comparison, is not as power hungry as WiFi, but it would have required a gateway in order to allow the user to reach the pads from outside.

We therefore decided for BLE, and automatic Background Synchronization. The user can decide how often he wants the Smartphone to synchronize with the pads and set the hours that he wants this synchronization to happen (it would be useless to try to sync when you are not home).  

At the same time we have already started the development of a BLE/WiFi gateway, to allow the users to have a real time access, if he or she wishes, and the development of pads based on WiFi technology, for "plugged" scenarios.

Can different people be linked on the same pad?

Every member of a family, or roommates, can have the data synched between them. So, if your partner consumes a good when you are away from home, his/her Smartphone will be synched, and so will be yours.

Which kind of alerts may I set up?

We have so far developed two kinds of alerts:

  1. Time based: at a certain time, specified by the user, the application will notify the user if an item is below a certain level (for example, a user can set the time that he usually gets out of the office, in order to be alerted if something needs to be procured before getting home).
  2. Person based: a message will automatically be sent to a person of choice when items go below a specified threshold (yourself, your partner, the grocery store, or catering service like the  scenario seen in the video regarding the Kitchen in ARM's laboratories).
  3. Geographically based: An alert will show up when you reach a specific place (like your local grocery store), for any item that is below a specified threshold (you need to have GPS enabled for this)
More might be introduced based on your suggestions
Would you provide API/SDKs for partners to integrate the pads in other systems?

We are very open to integrate SmartQsine into the current available Home Automation systems and provide the required APIs

You could either access to the pads directly and build/integrate your own application, or exploit all the development already undertaken by ourselves on the application side.

                            RISK & CHALLENGES


There is always a certain degree of risk, when you support a product that has not yet been certified. However, we think we have taken all the required measures to minimize it as far as reasonably possible, and are now able to go crowdfounding with an already developed product, intensively tested, showed and demoed in public.

What we are missing is the money to move to full scale production, and believe that with the target set in this campaign, it would be more than enough to achieve this.

We have also decided against going for flexible funding, since receiving less money than what we believe is required for full production, would have jeopardized the ability to fulfill our commitment to our backers, and hence our decision to approach the crowdfunding marketplace.

story:
Business is good. To make it great, I need you!

This business activation  means more hot new books at your fingertips, more options with colors, sizes and variations, and especially more housewares (shipping larger pieces, decorative objects and so on.) 

 

DESIGN&FORM, CONTENT CREATION

The Oracle of Becoming is almost sold out of its first run and the 2nd edition is in production as I write this now. Any additional funds will go towards all the supplies I need to continue to provide exceptional service and fast shipping, including supporting my painting and writing new works to offer you. (I’m only 33 years old, one oracle and one teeny e-book in, and I have so much more to share!) 

Divine Junk aims to create an accelerated spiritual pathway and digital space that uplifts and inspires. Your money (even a $1!!) creates  working capital that helps to avoid high interest bank loans and bring a flow of positive energy into my business. 

 

MOLLY WENT BALI

This is my 2nd fundraiser on IndieGoGo! The first one made it possible for my to live my dreams as a yogi in Ubud, Bali!! Indonesia is a blissful place. I met my goal off-indie-gogo fundraising via my website through tarot classes, goddess circles and more! 

Your support was so heart-warming, and so special. After completing 200 hrs of study, I created a meditation class for Ludlow House NYC, created "Venus Flow Yoga" yoga classes at my 5th avenue loft studio rental, and even brought the teachings to my hometown in Indiana through vinyasa at two local studios. This physical activation enhanced my dance studies and led to a scholarship to study at Omega Institute, and more! 

Last time I didn't take enough pictures and I wish I'd shared the day-to-day experience with you more, so this time around I'll share more behind the-scenes photos (on Instagram), I promise!!

 

SHARING IS CARING 

1) donate

2) share this fundraiser!

story:
Myself

I'm Ollie Piepereit the founder of OP Woodcraft. I specialise in bespoke furniture design, refinishing and run workshops tutoring traditional arts and crafts. 

This is my story so far..............

So the next chapter has arrived. I have the keys for the new workshop and the place needs an entire overhaul WHICH I PLEASE NEED YOUR HELP WITH!

I’m so excited but also very emotional after a rather eventful 4 years.

I started OP Woodcraft due to rather unexpected heart failure, difficulties managing mental health and an overwhelming desire to take control of my future. I wanted to find balance, fulfilment in my career and most importantly see my two beautiful children grow up.

Well I did that and more! My life is controlled by myself, I’m so happy, stressed in a completely manageable way,  healthy (touch wood) and I get to balance work and family in a way that works perfectly for us all.

Amongst a great deal of stress and heart ache I stumbled across my soul mate Emily Redford and my family instantly grew. With Emily’s three little boys too, our home is hectic, messy and full of love. Emily just so happens to be a talented artist and we share the same outlook on life a desire to recycle, design, innovate and teach arts and crafts. She will be joining me in the business and showcasing her own art work. So, it is time to expand, improve on production time, increase our skill set, offer more courses/workshops and to try to establish the business as I wrote 4 years ago in my business plan.

Why we are campaigning for a helping hand

The money we're asking for is to make the new workshop/school a safe, clean, warm and inviting place for myself, my partner and for our students.

This is not any old cry for help. Everything you put in to fund the renovation you'll receive a product of choice in return. Whether it be a coat hook, a piece of fine art, a bespoke dining table or a day’s tuition in French polishing it will all help towards the following:

- A complete wall strip, boarding and painting.

- We have no heating which we desperately need before winter. A reclaimed wood-burning stove is on the wish list

- We need a second hand fridge, reclaimed sink and worktop (and all the plumbing)

- Renovate the toilets

- A new stud wall to separate the machine shop and the teaching area

- Clean, buff and seal the concrete floor

Future Plan

Our main goal is to forge a creative hub in the heart of the Cotswolds. Not only will we hand craft our own work but we will pass on our knowledge and hopefully create an abundance of people carrying on a resurgent arts and crafts scene.

We also want to give back to the local community and hope to run workshops for those living in rural isolation and help younger people gain employability skills. We are also dedicated to making the business as accessible as possible to those on lower incomes. We would love to be able to welcome people to community workshops where they bring along their old furniture and learn how to give it a new lease of life for a nominal fee.

 

Final words

If you made it this far then I'm truly grateful. If you can't support us financially then can you please share on social media. Every little helps.

story:
Imagine finding an archival film of your grandparents, or a student film your parent shot in high school. You want to preserve it, make it viewable on more platforms, and even improve its quality. But to do so you have to risk shipping to another state, pay a hefty premium, and wait an extended period of time to get results.
With a Kinetta, a Hollywood grade 4k film scanner, Seattle can enjoy a local, high-quality film preservation service at a fraction of current prices and a fast turnaround.

 I'm Steven Bradford. As a filmmaker with almost 4 decades of experience as a producer, a cinematographer, an editor, and a film lab worker, I care deeply about preserving and improving resources for local filmmakers.

I’m launching this Indiegogo campaign so I can bring a vital service to filmmakers in Seattle and the Pacific Northwest.

For those of us continuing to shoot some of our productions on 16mm or 8mm movie film, or for documentarians using archive film, there are currently no local or regional services available offering the highest quality captures to 4k digital files.

Instead, we must ship off our film to Burbank, Denver, or Boston, where the choices are expensive and slow. For those of us with valuable old film, whether family memories or important moments in Seattle’s past, we’re understandably nervous about sending those precious captured memories so far off. Also, many of these oldest films are fading, and they won’t always be able to extract the color or even the images from them.

A Kinetta scanner can solve these issues. This amazing piece of equipment not only captures film to digital at high resolution, preserving all the detail, highlights, and shadows, but it is also incredibly gentle on old films that have curled or shrunk--or have tears and holes.

Even better, It’s a fraction of the cost of what professional scanners at this quality level have been. They can cost as much as half a million dollars, but the new Kinetta for 16mm and 8mm film is a fraction of that. I’ll be able to offer much more affordable scanning costs--especially for productions, archives, and schools that often have many reels to capture at a time.

I'm a freelance cinematographer deeply interested in keeping film work active in the northwest, but I don’t have deep pockets.


To jumpstart the service, I will be offering film transfers as donation rewards. I’ll start with one small roll of 16mm or 8mm digitized at the $15 level, to five rolls at the $50 level and on up, providing larger discounts for bulk work. In addition, I’ll make it a transferable certificate so even if you don’t personally have the film right now, you can give it to a friend or relative who does.

Although many major films in Los Angeles or New York, from big studios to indies continue to be photographed on film, and they can see the results of their work in a day. But in Seattle  we wait several days or a week or more to get our results. It's particularly difficult for students, because assignments can’t be turned around quickly during a term, or in a workshop, the way we used to in the northwest. Though film still  has to be sent out for processing, that is usually turned around in a day or two in Burbank, but the essential next step of digitizing adds a week or more to that.

My solution is to bring a high end 4k film scanner, (above) called a Kinetta, to the Pacific Northwest. This amazing piece of equipment not only captures film to digital at high resolution, preserving all the detail, highlights and shadows--it is incredibly gentle on old films that have curled or shrunk -- or even has tears and holes.  (see demo video below)

 

Here's an example of what the scanner can do to get all the quality that's always been in film, but wasn't accessible till now with 4k wide dynamic range tech on the latest scanners:


Even better, it’s a fraction of the cost of what professional scanners at this quality level have been. They can cost as much as half a million dollars, but the new Kinetta for 8 and 16mm film is a tenth of that. That will enable me to offer much more affordable scanning costs, especially for productions, archives and schools that often have many reels to capture at a time.Still that’s a big risk for me to take on. I'm a freelance cinematographer deeply interested in keeping film work active in the northwest, but I don’t have deep pockets. To jumpstart the service, I will be offering film transfers as donation rewards.
I’ll start with 1 small roll of 16 or 8mm digitized at the $15 level, to five rolls at the $50 level and on up, with bigger and bigger discounts. I’ll make it a transferable certificate, so even if you don’t personally have film right now, you can give it to a friend or relative who does. Of course, if you just want to see this service become available in the northwest, and contribute extra, that's possible too.My funding goal is set so that if I can get halfway to what I'll need to order the Kinetta for 8 to 16 film, I'll be able to go ahead and order the unit, and I can start transforming film right away.

Why do I think I’ll be able to do this successfully?

Number one, I don’t need to set up a lab. The Kinetta is a table top unit, it doesn’t need high power, compressed air, plumbing and other infrastructure requirements of the big iron legacy units. It is more of a PC peripheral.


My own experience with film is deep. My first job after USC film School was at a Hollywood lab, where I transferred film, and duplicated master tapes for MGM and Goldwyn to send their features out to movie channels and VHS distributors. Since then I’ve worked with many transfer units, from the big Rank Cintels to small projector telecines.  In fact part of the reason I'm doing this is my own frustration with the mediocre HD Telecines I've used in the last few years.
(Here's a shot of me as a young'in, interning at Hughes Aircraft, where I transferred films and slides to video using the unit in the upper right).

I’ll be keeping overhead low by not setting up a big office space to run this -- I’ll be the one doing the work. 
Another service I'll be offering is on site transfers for institutions that can't let their fragile, valuable films leave their premises.  The unit is easily transported by car and set up in an office.

So take a look at the funding tiers. Let me know if I should tweak or add to them. 
 Help bring professional 4k film capture to the Northwest, resurrect your own films that are languishing un-watched in a box!              

Making Everything Film New Again!

story:
SHORT SUMMARY

  I would like to draw your attention today to the dramatic situation currently enduring gays in Africa.
Many countries of the African continent apply repressive legislations with anti-gay laws and consider homosexuality like a crime.
Regarding violations of LGBT rights in many Countries in Africa, the following cases are recurring:
- Arbitrary arrests and unlawful detentions: Committed by law enforcement officers, these violations are intended to intimidate and extortion of victims then would follow  unlawful detentions that can lead to physical abuse such as  rape and other degrading treatment such as requiring a detainee to get naked and anally insertion of some objects like stick!
- Infringement procedures: Once a LGBT person is arrested, fundamental rights such as the presumption of innocence and the right to silence and the presence of a lawyer are omitted.
- Demonization by some populist politicians and evangelists: most preachers of evangelists churches have  very homophobic speech towards LGBT. They use to associate homosexuality with Satanism. On the other side, some politicians reinforce this hatred towards LGBT by their statements claiming that the relations between two men or two women is an import from Europe and America. They add that this form of sexuality is not in agreement with African traditions. To better support their ideas, they even introduce legislations to ban homosexuality .
- Discrimination on medical care: LGBT person are discriminated when they want to access medical care they need to survive in case of health problems (the case of people with STDs or HIV / AIDS). There is also violation of the right to privacy because the HIV status of LGBT persons is often disclosed by the nursing staff of hospitals in order to humiliate them.


What We need and what you can do

 We are in the 21st century and no one deserves to be abused or persecuted or deprived of their fundamental rights because of their sexual identity. It is time to act now to stop this! That’s why we want to create an NGO that will be called "FREEDOM AND EQUALITY FOR ALL" to speak for the entire gay community victim of this unfair discrimination and fight well against this discrimination and advocate for equality for all. And this by setting up projects for the legal, psychological and moral assistance to LGBT persons as well as a propaganda program for raising awarness of  HIV AIDS and the medical care assistance  of HIV-positive LGBT persons.
 We want through this NGO draw the attention of millions of people around the world to mobilize and sensitize them to the cause of LGBT community persecuted and discriminated in Africa.
 We  need  $50,000 to create this NGO and start its projects and if we can reach more than $50,000 we will expand many projects to all africans countries where LGBT persons are persecuted and discriminated.
Help us, because every single dollar you will donate counts enormously to the success of the cause of egality for everyone!

Risks and Challenges

Fighting against prejudice, discrimination and homophobia, and especially when it is fueled by political authorities and religious institutions especially the Evangelical Churches  very inked in many african countries is not easy because we have to deal with threats and blackmail that could endanger our lives.But we won’t cross the arm and we will fight to the end so that equality prevails for all and we believe that we will get there with your support both moral and financial.

Others ways you can Help

You can share this campaign with family ,friends and colleagues, to anyone who can help us raise the funds.

Our Team

  • Most famous product is Twin1 shutter release and Action Level, Zigview and some others.

story_txt:
Our Team



 

 We are Seculine, based on Seoul, Korea.


Seculine has been established in 2002. Initially major products are accessories for DSLR camera.


Most famous product is Twin1 shutter release and Action Level, Zigview and some others.

Initially major products are peripherals of DLSR camera.
Most famous product is Zigview and twin1 Shutter release as well as action level, etc.

story:
Life Shell is a project that aims to build a prototype and test the next generation of emergency and rescue crafts.

An inflatable craft that allows to survive and withstand any kind of emergencies.
- IMPACT / SHOCK ABSORBENT ( Kevlar, Zylon and CNF, Airbags )
-  HEAT RESISTANT / FIRE PROTECTIVE ( Zylon Buffer Layers )
- FLOATING LIFE RESCUE SHELL ( Safe Emulsion Nitrogen Agar Gel )
- INFLATABLE EASY TO STORE 

Just $1 can put this project in motion and assure a safer world for our children. 

You would not take a chance with a cupcake, why would you with the future of your kids? Think of it as bubble wrap for the future of your children…



A BRIEF INTRODUCTION

The world's cities are sprouting with plans for new towers and skyscrapers, a sign of twin booms in creativity and wealth. But many people still have concerns for safety & survival  in case of emergency.

Motivated by the latest news of shocking earthquake and natural disasters around the world we thought of a device that can potentially save thousands of lives and avoid casualties.

This project aims ultimately to build a prototype and test the next generation of emergency and rescue crafts. This technology offers emergency aerial to ground protection for people in a crisis situation, similar by comparison to  what life rafts provide for people in shipwrecks at sea.

http://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2015/07/20/the-really-big-one

LET'S GET PREPARED. A natural disaster of titanic proportions is overdue to strike the U.S., physicist Michio Kaku warns.

http://www.cbsnews.com/news/titanic-earthquake-tsunami-overdue-wipe-portions-pacific-northwest/

Thailand Tsunami 2004

JAPAN EARTHQUAKE & TSUNAMI 2011

EXTENDED TECHNOLOGY APPLICATION FOR SHIP'S SAFETY

It is very common for a ship to lean on one side before sinking making impossibe to lower life boats and life rafts  during abandon ship emergencies. Life shell technology could potentially solve this issue and guarantee emergency escape in any circumstances.


EXTENDED TECHNOLOGY APPLICATION FOR AVIATION SAFETY

Life shell technology could potentially be use for emergency escape or embedded into modern airplane architecture to provide extra level of protection to passengers in case of emergency and crash landing . Lining the fuselage with Kevlar and non newtonian fluid mixture would help the structure stay intact and not brake off in peaces while offering protection to passengers from fire related injuries. Airbags and crash sensor could help passengers also avoid injuries during crash landing.

WHAT IS LIFE SHELL?

The life shell is a inflatable  craft that can easily be deployed  from any structure including skyscrapers or airplanes for emergency escape and rescue in case of accidents, natural disasters, destructive fires, tsunamis and even in the case of terrorist attacks. Life Shell can protect people in case of building collapse thanks to its impact resistance and heat protective properties.

HOW DOES IT WORKS ? 

IMPACT/SHOCK ABSORBENT ( Kevlar, Zylon lining, Airbags, QR Parachute)

This invention utilize a combination of non-newtonian fluids technology along with Kevlar airbags that allows the life shell to be shock resistant for high altitude drops and high pressures due to high force impacts . Additionally a quick release parachute is utilized in case of high altitude drops to slow down accidental fast acceleration and ultimately guarantee a safe descent .

A dilatant Non- Newtonian fluid provides protection, as well as material flexibility.

The inner lining of the life shell is composed of freely moving molecules however, upon impact the molecules bind together turning the soft putty into a solid block barrier.


HEAT RESISTANT / FIRE PROTECTIVE ( Zylon , SEAgel )

 SEAgel (Safe Emulsion Agar gel) is one of a class of high-tech foam materials known as aerogels. It is an excellent thermal insulator . This material is used to line the inner and outer layers of the Life Shell craft to enable it to withstand fire and be heat resistant. Also the Zylon material used on outer layers and airbags act as additional level of thermal insulation and protection from fire.


FLOATING LIFE RESCUE SHELL ( Safe Emulsion Nitrogen Agar Gel )

SEAgel (Safe Emulsion Agar gel) can be made lighter than air using hydrogen - causing it to float or hang in the air. It insulates against temperature, noise, and electric current. SEAgel is also completely biodegradable, as it is made entirely of biological material and can even be eaten.

 


INFLATABLE, EASY TO STORE & EASY TO DEPLOY ( Inflatable )

Life Shell prototype we will be making consist of a single seater inflated sphere shaped craft.  Having said that there are no limitation for this technology to be shaped differently in future application and development. 

The inflatable property of Life Shell make it extremely compact easy to store and deploy in case of emergency.


            



THE MAKING OF LIFE SHELL PROTOTYPE, BASIC REQUIREMENTS, SKETCHES

Deployed Parachute

Outer Airbags

Inner Airbags


The Inner Shell

The inner shell has a main entrance, a sealing door, an air tight surviving area, after impact floating airbags, air emergency supplies, safety seats and belts, frontal impact protective  cushions, fire extinguisher, gps locator, on board computer, communication systems and water and surviving supplies . 

The outer layer of the inner shell is made of Kevlar lined with polyethylene and special dust (non-newtonian fluid mixture) to make it impact and puncture resistant. The non Newtonian fluid properties protect the inner area also from heat and deformation from impact.

The life shell is also designed to float and keep the inhabitants safe in case of ocean surges and tsunamis.

The Outer Shell

It contains the inner shell and has an anchor point to grip to mount and releases mechanisms. It holds gas tanks for external airbags, the external airbags, mounting springs to inner shell. On this shell we have cameras feeding wirelessly to the inner shell.

HELP US HELP BUILD A SAFER WORLD

After 5 years spent in collecting technical data and executing research studies in collaboration with SACEMP Engineering Ltd we are closer than ever to make the life shell a reality. We are raising money to build a prototype and test it so that we can possibly consider a market pilot in the near future. 

WHAT'S THE MONEY FOR ?

I'm asking for $50’000 to build a prototype of a new emergency rescue craft concept. It is just the beginning, but with your help this incredible project can become a reality and save many lives in the near future. 

THE MAKING OF THE ACTUAL SHELL 

The money raised will go mostly into the manufacturing of prototype including material, mold and castings. 

ON BOARD ELECTRONICS BY INTEL EDISON

A small portion will go into hardware and software development for airbags and shoots release synchronization. A particular thanks to Intel Edison platform that enable us to lower our over all development costs . http://tinyurl.com/lgqbb8t


WILL IT WORK? HOW CAN THIS DEFY THE LAW OF PHYSICS?

Yes, it is possible for it to work and no, it does not defy the laws of physics. Most of the work is done by the on-board high speed computing synchronization system and sensors. 

One of the essential elements for this technology to work is the exact timing and sequence in which each element is deployed during release and landing. Very similar by comparison on how ABS, Airbag and automated safety systems work on cars. Also to adopt high efficiency and quick release best-of-class parachutes have a huge impact on the overall functunality of the system. 

The latest development in terms of materials also plays a key role. The utilization of dilatant Non-Newtonian fluids in conjunction with Kevlar, Zylon and CNF materials have resulted in optimized distribution of force along the entire structure and allow best shock absorption during landing and ultimatelly avoid hot-spots upon impact.

 The introduction of SEAgel Hydrogen based foam has been also extremely important for optimal thermal insulation and make Life Shell fire resistant. Being SEAgel lighter than air also allows for overall weight to be reduced and improve floating and gliding capabilities.


The history of human tragedy is one story that unfortunately never ends. A lesson to be learned and yet we sometimes assume invulnerability.

This is a humble request for your help to brake the pattern. Let’s build a safer World together. 

Sometimes tragedies of great magnitude and importance occur that the memory of them refuses to fade away—they become legendary. We relive the details and continue to be transfixed by the unfolding horror of the event. 

The sinking of the Titanic, which took place 90 years ago on April 15, 1912, is one of such memories. Over the years, this shocking event has taken an almost mythical status and become a metaphor for technological failure. But have we really come that far in 2015, in regards to prevention and rescue technology for these and other kind of high risk emergency situations?

The answer for me is, not far enough. 

The world's cities are sprouting with plans for new towers and skyscrapers, a sign of twin booms in creativity and wealth. But are they as safe as we perceive them to be ? Many scientists warn us that it is not the case. All it would take is unprecedented series of events for disaster to strike.

Does it sound familiar? What if I tell you that tragedies that can result in high casualty rates can be reduced, if not stopped from happening completely. What if I tell you that you have the opportunity to brake the pattern and contribute to a greater good. Would you contribute ?

In the era of globalization, traveling, also has changed drastically since the tragic event of the titanic sinking 90 Years ago. For example, in 2011 alone, 413 million distinct individuals traveled by air at some point . That would translate into about 6 percent of the world's population flying somewhere and back at least once in 2011. 

And yet in 2015 we don’t have implemented technology that can offer hope to travelers for survival in case of catastrophic failure in an airplane or let alone a large, high-altitude structure as in Sky scrapers. All that is left , in case of a Airplane failure in 90% of the cases, is just search, rescue and count the casualties in the after-math and pray & pay our respects for the countless lost souls. And, As far as sky scrapers, a pure example of an unexpected tragedy is 911, with an astounding , 2,606 casualties in the Twin Towers back in 2001. Realistically, the chance at survival, given the circumstances and options was little to none.

Does it sound familiar? It does sound familiar to me, this happens everyday, lives are lost, many due to little chance of survival rate due to the safety options available. Our lives are put to the test every time we board a craft or enter a building, there is always a risk. it is this undeniable vulnerability in what we do, that we take for granted and yet we place ourselves in high-risk situations to live our lives day in and day out. There is a chance we can eliminate the odds against us in surviving catastrophes! This message is for my fellow human beings, all around the world, I welcome you to the awareness in regards to this matter and hope you share my vision and hopes to build a safer world and bring this visionary project to life.

Life Shell is a project that aims to build a prototype and test the next generation of emergency and rescue crafts.
An inflatable craft that allows to survive and withstand any kind of emergencies.
- IMPACT / SHOCK ABSORBENT ( Kevlar, Zylon and CNF, Airbags )
-  HEAT RESISTANT / FIRE PROTECTIVE ( Zylon Buffer Layers )
- FLOATING LIFE RESCUE SHELL ( Safe Emulsion Nitrogen Agar Gel )
- INFLATABLE EASY TO STORE 




Just $1 can put this project in motion and assure a safer world for our children. 
You would not take a chance with a cupcake, why would you with the future of your kids? Think of it as bubble wrap for the future of your children…





A BRIEF INTRODUCTION The world's cities are sprouting with plans for new towers and skyscrapers, a sign of twin booms in creativity and wealth. But many people still have concerns for safety & survival  in case of emergency.

Motivated by the latest news of shocking earthquake and natural disasters around the world we thought of a device that can potentially save thousands of lives and avoid casualties.
This project aims ultimately to build a prototype and test the next generation of emergency and rescue crafts. This technology offers emergency aerial to ground protection for people in a crisis situation, similar by comparison to  what life rafts provide for people in shipwrecks at sea.
http://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2015/07/20/the-really-big-one

LET'S GET PREPARED. A natural disaster of titanic proportions is overdue to strike the U.S., physicist Michio Kaku warns.
http://www.cbsnews.com/news/titanic-earthquake-tsunami-overdue-wipe-portions-pacific-northwest/



Thailand Tsunami 2004

JAPAN EARTHQUAKE & TSUNAMI 2011

It is very common for a ship to lean on one side before sinking making impossibe to lower life boats and life rafts  during abandon ship emergencies. Life shell technology could potentially solve this issue and guarantee emergency escape in any circumstances.

Life shell technology could potentially be use for emergency escape or embedded into modern airplane architecture to provide extra level of protection to passengers in case of emergency and crash landing . Lining the fuselage with Kevlar and non newtonian fluid mixture would help the structure stay intact and not brake off in peaces while offering protection to passengers from fire related injuries. Airbags and crash sensor could help passengers also avoid injuries during crash landing.

story:
Short Summary

We are a group of Greek citizens fed up by the repressive and restrictive laws of the Greek state and we are hungry for change.

Marijuana legalization would result to thousands of new jobs and opportunities for the Greek economy. It will boost tourism, services and agriculture following the examples of Uruguay, Colorado, Washington and other states. It will also offer patients a crucial alternative on conventional commercial drugs. But most importantly it will end a chronic violation of human rights in our country, regarding mistreatment of cannabis users as a result of the draconian laws currently enforced that have resulted in cannabis users being prisoned for even minimal amounts.

There are numerous groups lobbying for the legalization of marijuana in Greece, but currently this issue is absent from the political agenda of all major parties.

Help us get marijuana legalization right in the heart of the political agenda!


What We Need & What You Get

We have thoroughly prepared a plan that would enable us to reach higher and establish the marijuana legalization as one of the priorities in the reforms of the Greek penal code and the transformation of the public opinion.

Let's elaborate more on that and talk money. These are our estimates:

  • €2,000 for the legal procedures of establishing a new political party in Greece
  • €10,000 for the participation in the upcoming (September 2015) Parliamentary Elections
  • €8,000 for the promotion of our party and our goals. It is crucial to prepare promotional material to ensure that our ideas reach the vast majority of the Greek society!
  • €10,000 for the establishment of a think tank of lawyers, doctors and policy makers that will propose abstract changes to the Greek legislation. We want to ensure that no politicians will be able to accuse us of being to general in our  It is crucial to prepare promotional material to ensure that our ideas reach the vast majority of the Greek voters. or that our proposals lack a scientific basis.

We believe it is crucial to ensure that every last penny donated to us will be used for the promotion of our goal. On the other hand, we would like to express our gratefulness to our supporters. Therefore we will send a pin from our campaign to everyone who contributes €100 or more!


The Impact

We will change the stance on marijuana and its users once and for all. Through our party we are expecting:

  • The radical reforms of the Greek laws on drugs, legalizing the cultivation and use of marijuana for medical and recreational purposes
  • The establishment of Social Cannabis Clubs following the example of Barcelona
  • The lanch of an educational campaign to inform the public about the challenges of marijuana legalization and the health issues


Other Ways You Can Help

In case you are not in a position to support us financially, you can:

  • Share our Indiegogo campaign with your friends
  • Share our Facebook page with your friends
  • Spread the word!

Show you solidarity to Greek cannabis users and liberate this wonderful plant!
