story:
Empowering Women Through Dress

JUNE DRESSES™ is a growing social movement that seeks to make a difference by raising funds and awareness for women-focused causes while promoting female empowerment and self confidence. At the center of our efforts is a month-long, peer-to-peer fundraising campaign for women. After all, if men can do good by growing facial hair in November, imagine what women can do by wearing a dress each day in June... are you as excited as we are?

Each year, JUNE DRESSES™ participants accept a 30-day clothing challenge: to go the month of June without pants! Personal pledge pages, setup through junedresses.com, enable participants to share their progress, post photos of daily outfits, raise awareness and solicit donations. Check out #junedresses to see some of the creative ways women have fun with our campaign or watch our participant testimonial video:

Perhaps most importantly, women finish the month feeling more confident, empowered and energized about life. 30-day challenges are known to create a sense of fulfillment for participants and JUNE DRESSES™ is no different. We help women feel good about themselves while supporting a good cause. 

Growing the Good

For the last three years, JUNE DRESSES™ has partnered with local women-focused charities in Calgary and Edmonton, Alberta, Canada.

Our pilot campaigns have been a big success with over 500 hundred participants raising more than $90,000 for a variety of local women-focused causes. Now we're looking to  expand JUNE DRESSES™ as a fundraising campaign throughout Canada and the United States. Expanding nationally requires partners with a national focus and we are eager to speak with women-focused charities and corporate sponsors about potential partnership opportunities.

We believe empowering women is key to building a great community for all. It helps create stronger families and confident individuals, which will strengthen the lives of those around us. JUNE DRESSES™ has helped support women in areas such as immigration, safety, domestic violence, poverty and mental health by raising funds and awareness. The broader we expand, the more good we can go and you can help!


Your Contributions

Our goal is to give as much as possible to our charitable partners. We're very proud of the fact that in three years of fundraising, every dollar raised through JUNE DRESSES™ has gone directly to our charitable partners. To continue this model, we need funding for two main areas: website development and advertising. 

  • Website Development: as a web-based, peer-to-peer fundraising initiative, our online presence is of utmost importance. We need money to integrate a payment processing application that will allow our participants to raise money through JUNE DRESSES™ from anywhere in the world. 
  • Advertising: we have to get the word out. Our success so far has been based on word-of-mouth. We have a real opportunity to help causes make a positive impact in the lives of women. But to do so, we need more participants next June and to get more participants, we need to advertise. 
If we don't reach our goal, we will make the most of what we were able to raise by using it to fund the three areas described above.


Perks in Support of Women!

JUNE DRESSES™ works in support of women and our perks do the same. We will be adding new perks throughout the campaign to support women-run businesses. If you have a women-made product or service you would like showcase to a community interested in helping women, please email us to discuss what type of perk we can offer.

LIMITED EDITION (only 10 available): From fashion designer Lara Presber's Commute line, this is a beautiful one-size-fits-all skirt with a black and white graffiti print on the front and a contrast pink back panel and ties. Free shipping in Canada and the US! June Dresses is proud to support women-run businesses like Lara's.

More photos posted as an Update.


CHARITABLE DONATION: We have three amazing offers to donate a percentage of your contribution to the United Nation's Fund for Gender Equality. The more you contribute to JUNE DRESSES™ the greater the donation percentage!



Your Chance to Make a Difference

JUNE DRESSES™ has been around since 2010. In that time, we've had to face our fair share of challenges. From people questioning our cause (we've heard it all) to lack of funding and resources. Throughout it all, we've focused on the positive and made the most of our opportunities, learning with each step.

There will be a JUNE DRESSES™ fundraising campaign in 2016. The scale of it will depend on the success of our crowdfunding. This is your chance to contribute to a campaign that harnesses the incredible power women have to make a difference in each other's lives.

We have seen firsthand the positive impact JUNE DRESSES™ can have on community and confidence. We trust in our process and know the good it will bring to the world. Our biggest challenge right now is getting the word out. Support shown through Indiegogo will go a long way in making that happen.

To learn more about how JUNE DRESSES™ came to be, you can watch this interview with Founder, Adrienne Donnelly.

Adrienne Donnelly, Founder of June Dresses, interviewed on Alberta Prime Time


Other Ways You Can Help

If you know of a potential corporate sponsor or women-focused cause that could benefit from JUNE DRESSES™, please let them know about this page using the Indiegogo share tools!

You can also follow us on social media and participate next June!
Thank you to Calgary designer, Lara Presber, for donating a custom-fitted dress to the top fundraiser in 2014. Please get in touch with us if you represent a retail brand who would like to discuss partnership opportunities.

Perks in Support of Women!

JUNE DRESSES™ works in support of women and our perks do the same. We will be adding new perks throughout the campaign to support women-run businesses. If you have a women-made product or service you would like showcase to a community interested in helping women, please email us to discuss what type of perk we can offer.


LIMITED EDITION (only 10 available): From fashion designer Lara Presber's Commute line, this is a beautiful one-size-fits-all skirt with a black and white graffiti print on the front and a contrast pink back panel and ties. Free shipping in Canada and the US! June Dresses is proud to support women-run businesses like Lara's.
More photos posted as an Update.



CHARITABLE DONATION: We have three amazing offers to donate a percentage of your contribution to the United Nation's Fund for Gender Equality. The more you contribute to JUNE DRESSES™ the greater the donation percentage!








Your Chance to Make a Difference JUNE DRESSES™ has been around since 2010. In that time, we've had to face our fair share of challenges. From people questioning our cause (we've heard it all) to lack of funding and resources. Throughout it all, we've focused on the positive and made the most of our opportunities, learning with each step.
There will be a JUNE DRESSES™ fundraising campaign in 2016. The scale of it will depend on the success of our crowdfunding. This is your chance to contribute to a campaign that harnesses the incredible power women have to make a difference in each other's lives.
We have seen firsthand the positive impact JUNE DRESSES™ can have on community and confidence. We trust in our process and know the good it will bring to the world. Our biggest challenge right now is getting the word out. Support shown through Indiegogo will go a long way in making that happen.
To learn more about how JUNE DRESSES™ came to be, you can watch this interview with Founder, Adrienne Donnelly.


Adrienne Donnelly, Founder of June Dresses, interviewed on Alberta Prime Time

Other Ways You Can Help


If you know of a potential corporate sponsor or women-focused cause that could benefit from JUNE DRESSES™, please let them know about this page using the Indiegogo share tools!


You can also follow us on social media and participate next June!

Thank you to Calgary designer, Lara Presber, for donating a custom-fitted dress to the top fundraiser in 2014. Please get in touch with us if you represent a retail brand who would like to discuss partnership opportunities.

story:
Click sur ce lien pour la version française : http://www.los-halcones.com/test-3/


Haga clic en el enlace por la version española : http://www.los-halcones.com/bienvenida/


EVERYBODY COUNTS OR NOBODY COUNTS!


Los Halcones Football School & 7-a-side Pitch,

Club House & Youth Club



We are raising $300,000 US dollars to build a football pitch and clubhouse in San Miguel de Allende, a town in Mexico where over half the population is under 25 years old and living in poverty.



THE COACH :Natt Aouga


I am from Paris but spent my early childhood in one of the poorest countries in Africa and am a blend of those cultures. Both Togo and France are huge footballing nations and I’m a football coach.


With an instinctive understanding and love of children, from my early teens I’ve been involved with mentoring young people. At the age of 17, I became a youth leader and worked for over a decade in youth camps all over France, including those for the mentally and physically handicapped.  Twenty years on, I still get cards from some of those kids, now grown up and with lives of their own.  Giving encouragement and guidance to young people is my forte.


Football is my passion and through football I teach children respect, discipline and good sportsmanship in the firm belief that these qualities remain with them off the pitch. I am strict, very strict! And it works. 3 years ago, I set up a football school in San Miguel using a municipal pitch and we soon had around 40 children coming twice a week. They’re still coming and now we want to give them their own home.




THE PLACE:

San Miguel is one of Mexico’s top tourist destinations, a World Heritage site with 140,000 inhabitants, it is 2.5 hours north of the capital, Mexico City. There is a large foreign presence, mostly Americans and Canadians and although they represent less than 10% of the population, they have a considerable cultural and economic impact. But there are still many areas which don’t benefit. With a burgeoning youth population, there is huge unemployment, no regular sporting fixtures and no youth clubs.This project will create jobs and positively contribute to the community.



THE SCHOOL

By building a football pitch and setting up a club and league, my team and I will inspire children and guide them to be good human beings. Their self esteem will grow so they can be useful members of the community. My personal goal is not to be just another tourist enjoying the sun, but to make a real difference.


My motto is - everyone counts or nobody does.  Every child plays in every match, no matter their skill level. This means sometimes we lose. The children have come to understand why I do this. They’ve learned the basics, that being part of a team is more important than personal glory or winning. I am teaching them the longer game.


There are several international schools - but none with a dedicated football curriculum - and from our research there is a lot of interest in starting one.


Now we want to move the Los Halcones project to the next stage.



THE PROJECT:

We have a hectare of desert land fed by natural spring water with mains electricity. We have obtained planning permission to build a 7 a side artificial football pitch, a car park and the Los Halcones building containing the cafe / clubhouse and salon de fiestas (event space).


The land is on a bus route just a couple of kilometers outside San Miguel and is easily accessible from the town. It’s surrounded by burgeoning villages with no provision for young people, either sports facilities, cafes or any youth clubs. Literally hundreds of youngsters in these communities will benefit from the school.


Football is a national obsession in Mexico and this is a project that will grow and grow as new members join. There is a huge demand in the town for pitches, and they’re not always available.



The Pitch:

It will take 3 months to level the ground and build the pitch and the car park. We aim to build a 7 a side artificial pitch 60m x 38m, which meets international standards, complete with lights to play at night. While local schools and the Los Halcones children’s team will use this pitch during the day, local adult teams will hire it after 6pm and at the weekends.  This will generate revenue for the business and subsidise the kids.


To build the pitch we need $100,000 US dollars as a first step. $85,000 for the pitch and an extra $15,000 for toilets, fencing and a small office.


The Clubhouse:

Los Halcones will have discrete spaces for the arts, music, exercise & classes for the community - all at low cost. In the open-plan cafe kitchen, cookery classes will be held. The space can also be hired out for gigs, events and parties. There will be a terrace from which spectators can watch the matches and a mini pitch to the side of the main pitch for the under 8s so that they can play while their parents play football or enjoy the club.  


To build this we will need $200,000 US dollars.


This is the initial design and we are working to finalise the details for the club.



THE BUSINESS:


We have put together a comprehensive business plan which is attached.  If this same project were attempted in cities like Paris or London the cost of building the pitch alone would be 5 times higher.


No child will be precluded from coming to classes because of any financial difficulties their family might have. We will set up a sliding scale membership fee so the poorest will pay next to nothing. The reason for always charging, is that in my experience, children and parents are more committed when they spend something - no matter how little.



THE TIME FRAME

We’d like to approach this project in 2 stages.


1) The first 3 months : Winter 2016 - Spring 2017:

To level the land and build the car park, the pitch and a temporary office with toilet facility.  

COST = $100,000 US dollars


2) The following 6 months : (Spring 2017 - end of Summer 2017)

To build the cafe/clubhouse/salon de fiestas and landscape the site.

COST = $200,000 US dollars



FUTURE PLANS

We will set up training courses for coaches and football camps for national and international students.


Our aim is to build a swimming pool (semi-Olympic / 25m) and provide swimming lessons to kids … and climbing walls ….. gradually Los Halcones will become a sports complex.  

What is going to happen to the money if we don't reach our goal.

If we don't reach a minimum of 75% of the goal, all funds will return immediately to the backers.


I know not everyone can contribute with money,... but you can help by spreading the words  to the world -let them all know!!!

story:
Highlights About This Campaign
  • I have owned this business for 14 years and I am at the place where I can see the potential of our brand with its inherit visibility, but I simply cannot get there if my daily workflow is consumed with self-sustaining tasks.  
  • Your contribution will help me find the RIGHT people to implement a solid booking and admissions team.  
  • Your contribution will help me utilize my existing space to the best of its capacity by implementing new lines of services that will allow me to take more "daily" clientele.  I.E. the makeup version of a "blow out bar"
  • Your contribution will help me finish the expansion into the second space.

Some Background Info

My Name is Alexa Prisco and I have owned The Glam Fairy for nearly 14 years.  My business has been featured on two shows on NBC's Style Network-- "Jerseylicious" and "Glam Fairy".  

Despite popular belief, I owned my business for roughly eight years BEFORE the show.  So all together, I have owned my business for 14 years.

When I first started out, I mainly offered Bridal Makeup.  Then I started hiring people and offering Bridal Hair, Extensions, Special Occasion Makeup etc.  Eventually I started training new artists to do events on the days I was already booked and ended up having a nice little team.

For the first eight years, I work from home.  Simply because the majority of my work was on location.

Eventually, I got a space in Hoboken which made me able to offer a wider range of services like photoshoots, workshops, events, and The Glam Academy (my makeup school).

Since the beginning, I have always had a thirst to learn whatever would give me more control over the final product.  For example, when I used to do makeup on photoshoots, it used to kill me that I just couldn't take the pictures myself.  And then one day, I figured "why not?".

When people meet me they are definitely surprised.  I think they expect to meet a little bit of a priss, but I am the polar opposite.  I am involved in every aspect of my business, down to the drills and wire cups.  

 I have somehow managed to see myself as separate departments (i.e. marketing, social management, i.t., web development, branding, booking agent, etc.)

I had my daughter (which was part of the show) just about three years ago.  The second I had her, I immediately had a hard time finding that perfect balance between my roles as a wife, mom, and business owner.

If successful, this campaign will allow my business to reach its true potential; It will allow me to finalize the expansion of our studio, it will allow me to implement the level of staffing I need to give this business the coverage it so desperately needs. 

I am the mom that is now calling clients with my daughter screaming in the background because I just lost yet another Nanny.  I am the mom pacing at the park using my "professional" voice to book a client as my daughter pulls at my leg for water.  I am the mom that listens to that inner guilt and temporarily ignores two emails worth 10 grande to give my daughter a half hour of focused attention.  I am the mom that has to fight tooth and nail for what feels like the right thing.  

I am a FIGHTER.  With all of this, my business manages to do incredibly well.  Definitely not what you would expect from the picture I just painted.  

I have owned my business for a long time.  MUCH longer than the show portrayed.  I know what it feels like to be dirt poor as I built this company from the ground up without a dime.  I know what it feels like to spend your last dollar on post cards for clients and shove ramen noodles in your mouth for a week.  I know what it feels like to earn a dollar.  I have worked very hard for a long time.  

I have gotten to the place where my business has an incredible amount of exposure, where my website has a ton of visitors, where all of the numbers are lining up.  I just need to get out of the "maintenance" phase.  I need to get to the place where other people are doing the daily workload and I can focus on expanding on all of the "one day" things.  

I need you to get ME past the place where my absence will not cause The Glam Fairy world to stop orbiting.  I need YOU to let my diaper bag be 10 pounds lighter (laptop free) because someone, somewhere, is helping me take care of it.  

What I need and what I can give you!

  • I need, at a minimum, 50,000.  I think I will break this campaign up into two parts to see if this is even possible.
  • This amount will cover some of the more recent expansion costs, a door between both spaces, at least a few meetings with a business advisor who can help me find the staff that will allow this business to become self sustaining.  Whereby I do not need to physically attached to my macbook for 15 hours a day.  
  • Keep in mind I have, for the most part, had an "assistant" on and off for about 10 years.  But it simply is not enough.  I need a staff that it utilizing the exposure and social visibility to its full capacity. 
  • I have been working relentlessly for 14 years and I am at the place where I know what this business is capable of, but I just can't get there if I'm stuck at the factory level.  Metaphorically, I can't invent and create new machines if I'm greasing, running, and loading the machines I already have.  I need to get to a better place of sustaining which can only happen with the right help.  And I can only get that help if I have the right people forensically examining every aspect of my business.  
  • I am all about stretching the dollar.  And that goes to the extent of forcing myself to learn a particular skill set rather than purchasing it.  So, if it comes to needing something sanded, I won't hire someone, Ill sand it myself.  If it comes to mounting something to a concrete wall, I won't hire someone, Ill do it myself!  
  • I am a 34 year old woman with two "fancy" tool kits, a regular drill, a Dremel, a jigsaw, a soldering gun, -- I have forced myself to learn more skill sets completely UNrelated to makeup in order to preserve that much more control.
  • The good thing about this campaign is that any amount will take some small chip off of my to do list.  

The Impact

  • Your contribution will help me find the RIGHT people to implement a solid booking and admissions team.  
  • Your contribution will help me utilize my existing space to the best of its capacity by implementing new lines of services that will allow me to take more "daily" clientele.  
  • Your contribution will help me finish the expansion into the second space.
  • This is the first time I have EVER tried something like this.  

Risks & Challenges

I have owned my business for over a decade and have encountered and endless sea of obstacles.  With that, I have always made choices that allow me to operate within my means.  

For any business, a bad month of mis-directed mail can have a devastating impact.  But its how you choose to react to the disaster that determines your fate.  I am relentless when it comes to my business, and I will learn whatever skill sets is necessary to overcome a challenge; with an ultimate refusal to be okay with bad circumstances.

story:
In the age of the Internet, ignorance is a choice, and we would like to help to provide information resources freely- to anyone who wants to learn about a myriad of topics. We aim for each text to be from a well-researched perspective as to avoiding disinformation.

We will strive to deliver a responsible, original, and independent analysis of world events and other major topics of interest and importance. In every situation, we will try our best to provide as much relevant information as possible, without flooding people with triviality or fear based sensationalism and propaganda.

The category of media freedom means the safety of a society and its institutions to speak freely in the formulation of public policy and to be able to highlight without fear a range of anti-social blocks to development such as corruption and human rights abuses

Freedom of speech is the main measure of openness in a society. Where there is room for dissent and new voices, there is space for people with all their differences. Yet this space is too often limited by those in power, mass media and large corporations that silence and marginalize voices through aggressive censorship, mass espionage and growing media monopolies.


These days, major media sources have too many ties with people and organizations that want to influence what’s reported—think billionaire owners, mega-corporations, and big-money advertisers.

The «Independent Media» will be a truly independent alternative because it will be one hundred percent people funded. Plus, while it shares a similar spirit with the bloggers and citizen reporters, Independent Media will have the resources and staffing to make it an easily accessed center stage for high-quality, independent reporting.

The organizers and authors Michael Gershzon and Sergey Koulby, in partnership with a network of experienced and international producers, editors, and independent investigative journalists, will offer original stories and investigative reports, editorials, and discussion forums within the «Independent Media» project.

«Independent Media» will be a news and multimedia network unlike anything else online, in print, or on TV. It will offer all of the elements people expect from a large news organization and also utilize social media, a mobile app (news alerts, etc.), and other Internet platforms.

The website is under construction


All «Independent Media» reports and multimedia productions will be entirely independent and nonpartisan and will be developed, written, produced, and vetted by our staff, which will be paid with funding from the public.

Except for special forums and roundtable discussions, all «Independent Media» contents will be free to the public. For those who want access to all of the site’s contents, the subscription fee will amount to $9.99 per month.

Our goal for the end of year two is to expand our subscriber base to 30,000. That would equate to $299,000 per/month, which would be enough to support «Independent Media» annual operations. Every dollar we receive that excess of our goal will go to funding further content, expanded program offerings, additional journalists, etc.

It’s time to stand up for our right to be informed and to establish an empowering, publicly funded media network that is accountable only to its viewers and to the truth.

To launch what we believe will be the first truly independent and agenda-free major media network; we need to raise a minimum of $412,000 in under 60 days.

Your help will enable us to set-up and begin operation by November 30, 2016. Your pledges will fund the following:

  • Web development (web design and programming)
  • Website promotion
  • Salary of company's employees (journalists, analysts, editors) during the first year
  • Website Technical Support
  • Other operating expenses
… Ask for details in the comments

We’d love you to support our efforts with a pledge. We also need your help to spread the word about «Independent Media» and activate others. Sharing on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, Instagram, YouTube, and other networks will be critical to the success of our collective dream.

Your sponsor certificate is waiting for you


Without you, we cannot build the independent news source that we deserve. We need you, your voice, and your commitment to our cause.

Any questions are welcome.

would like to help to provide information resources freely- to anyone who wants to
learn about a myriad of topics. We aim for each text to be from a
well-researched perspective as to avoiding disinformation.
We will strive to deliver a responsible, original, and
independent analysis of world events and other major topics of interest and
importance. In every situation, we will try our best to provide as much
relevant information as possible, without flooding people with triviality or
fear based sensationalism and propaganda.
The category of media freedom means the safety of a society
and its institutions to speak freely in the formulation of public policy and to be able to
highlight without fear a range of anti-social blocks to development such as corruption and
human rights abuses
Freedom of speech is the
main measure of openness in a society. Where there is room for dissent and new
voices, there is space for people with all their differences. Yet this space is too often limited by those in power, mass media and large corporations that
silence and marginalize voices through aggressive censorship, mass espionage
and growing media monopolies.These days,
major media sources have too many ties with people and organizations that want
to influence what’s reported—think billionaire owners, mega-corporations, and
big-money advertisers.
The
«Independent Media» will be a truly independent alternative because it will be
one hundred percent people funded. Plus, while it shares a similar spirit
with the bloggers and citizen reporters, Independent Media will have the
resources and staffing to make it an easily accessed center stage for
high-quality, independent reporting.
The
organizers and authors Michael Gershzon and Sergey Koulby, in partnership with
a network of experienced and international producers, editors, and independent
investigative journalists, will offer original stories and investigative reports, editorials, and
discussion forums within the «Independent Media» project.
«Independent
Media» will be a news and multimedia network unlike anything else online, in
print, or on TV. It will offer all of the elements people expect from a large
news organization and also utilize social media, a mobile app (news alerts, etc.),
and other Internet platforms.The website is under construction
All
«Independent Media» reports and multimedia productions will be entirely
independent and nonpartisan and will be developed, written, produced, and
vetted by our staff, which will be paid with funding from the public. 
Except for
special forums and roundtable discussions, all «Independent Media» contents
will be free to the public. For those who want access to all of the site’s
contents, the subscription fee will amount to $9.99 per month.
Our goal for the end of year two is to expand our
subscriber base to 30,000. That would equate to $299,000 per/month, which would
be enough to support «Independent Media» annual operations. Every dollar we receive that
excess of our goal will go to funding further content, expanded program offerings,
additional journalists, etc.
It’s time to stand up for our right to be informed and
to establish an empowering, publicly funded media network that is accountable
only to its viewers and to the truth.
To launch what we believe will be the first truly
independent and agenda-free major media network; we need to raise a minimum of
$412,000 in under 60 days.
Your help will enable us to set-up and begin operation
by November 30, 2016. Your pledges will fund the following:


Web development (web design and programming)


Website promotion


Salary of company's employees (journalists,
analysts, editors) during the first year


Website Technical Support


Other operating expenses


… Ask for details in the comments
We’d love you to support our efforts with a pledge. We
also need your help to spread the word about «Independent Media» and activate
others. Sharing on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, Instagram, YouTube, and other
networks will be critical to the success of our collective dream.Your sponsor certificate is waiting for youWithout you, we cannot build the independent news
source that we deserve. We need you, your voice, and your commitment
to our cause.
Any questions are welcome.

story: We're raising funds to finish our lash, wax, tan, & hair salon in Roseville, CA. The lease is signed!!! The sinks are bought!!! The paint is picked out!!! We will build a salon where women will be empowered. The women who walk in our doors will leave more confident knowing they can take on the world and this includes the women who work in our salon. We have both been in the beauty industry for over 12 years and we've seen it all. This industry is wonderful to be apart of because making women feel good about themselves is a beautiful feeling and we desire to make a place where the women who work there feel like they can make a difference in their lives financially. Our goal is empowering women and we can only do this with your help. We put together some amazing deals so we can give back to you for helping us and we cannot wait to make you "feel beautiful about yourselves" (A Britt-ism we love). We negotiated an amazing lease and the property owner and broker both believed in our vision and goals from the beginning. The sooner we get funded the sooner we can begin to build the business of our dreams and share it with all of you.

story:
Thanks for stopping by. We are passionate about creating the most amazing live music lounge and restaurant. Will you help us make our dream come true? If you know anyone who may be interested in being a partner or investor, let us know or direct them to this link https://www.zoomerscabaret.com/investor-opportunities

Please follow us at www.facebook.com/ZoomersCabaret

 

About Zoomer's.

Welcome to Zoomer's Cabaret. A unique, interactive concept in a bar/restaurant outing. The friendliest bar in town. Zoomer's main theme is one of “feeling like you're part of the experience” as opposed to an observer. Based around a raised, center stage (with an intimate feel) nightly you will find some form of entertainment. Our restaurant will be open nightly. A down to earth menu with signature cocktails and favorite feel good food offerings. Visit us at www.zoomerscabaret.com 

What makes Zoomer's unique.

One of the main things we realized that is missing for so many venues is, a sense of familiarity and community. We all remember Cheers. "Where everyone knows your name". People love being recognized and feeling like they are part of the community. A key ingredient we will strive for is building a strong sense of familiarity. Our staff will be trained in recognizing regulars and making them feel special. We are not kidding. We really are going for different. Our staff will be expert in friendliness and interacting with customers. Here is one small example of a creative idea to bring back customers regularly and giving them an opportunity to do something different. Once a month we will host "Rotating dinner. Meet new friends. " Guests can pre-register and come alone or with a guest. After introductions, guests will rotate on every course. Making new connections and enjoying tantalizing menu items or even a wine tasting. Our host will be on hand to make sure everything runs smoothly and guests have a memorable experience. Luckily we already have many other fun and interactive ideas ready to launch. Here's some examples:

  • We plan on hosting a musician's networking open mic night on Mondays.
  • We plan on hosting a monthly, business networking event, once a month on a Thursday.
  • We plan on hosting a 4 week "Palm Beach has talent" show twice a year on Tuesdays. Yup. Just like the show. With a grand finale party on a Saturday.
  • We plan on hosting a "Cinema night" once a month on Sundays' With giant screen, sound popcorn, hollywood theme the works. Guests will vote on movie choices online.
  • We plan on hosting a "family fun day" twice a year on a Saturday afternoon. Featuring our guests and their kiddies.  Discounted family menu, face painter, balloons and all the other kid friendly entertainment. 

The live music experience.  

We propose great drinks and dining within an always creative, live music experience. A monthly calendar will be posted on our website.  Changing it up week to week and always surprising our guests with fun and innovative theme nights and live bands. Our goal is to get them looking often because we change it up so often. Keeping it fresh and exciting. Some examples: Our Sunday brunches will have a different theme weekly. Gospel brunch. Jazz brunch, Techno brunch, soul brunch etc.. Nightly themes. Outlaw country night, Dueling pianos, DJ & margarita madness, Ladies night, Beetles tribute band, 70's flashback party, civil servant night, twofer tuesdays. For a complete calendar sample simply contact us.

About the founders.

After years working for other bar, restaurant and club owners, our dream is to open and create our very own vision. Something really different. We have so many years of experience in the industry. The main thing we took away from working for other bar owners? What not to do! Second, one of our key ingredients will be building a community based venue where the customer experience is our number one priority. Part of our goal is to go out of our way to build an experience where the customer can't wait to come back and tells their friends. Our first venue will be our testing ground. Once we have proven the concept we plan on re-creating the model in multiple cities. 

  Adrian Curran 

Adrian has years of experience in the bar and restaurant industry. After graduating high school, he started at the low level of barback at a major NYC night club. Quickly learning to bartend, he bartended at over 15 different bars and restaurants. Later, he went on to be the youngest Maître’ d at a popular NYC restaurant. Even though he was building an event planning business, it was this industry that has kept in the game throughout the years. In some form, he has bartended, managed, promoted and work in the bar/restaurant industry for over 30 years. Most recently, he has been on the management team at Blue Martini. References specific to this industry available upon request.

  Bruce Gregory

Bruce got his start in the industry at the age of 15 when he started his first job at the Wellington country club. He stayed with the club for the next four years . His roles included, line cook, waiter and host. At the age of 19, Bruce got his first experiences with the Bar business by helping his former coach open up an Irish Bar. It’s here where he learned all the aspects of bar management. At the age of 22, Bruce started working with Blue Martini. He moved his way up to management in the first 8 months and stayed with them until 2005 when he broke away and opened his first restaurant and nightclub. Savannahs and 23 Lounge. Bruce stayed with the company for 5 years before making his way back to South Florida and Blue Martini. Bruce managed the Boca Blue Martini for almost a decade and helped out with nearby locations. In 2019 Bruce started consulting with different bar and restaurant chains and is still doing so currently.

What We Need & What You Get

One of the main problems we face is getting started with enough funds to secure a lease, file for licensing, permits and have some working capital. We are currently working with investors to be  part of our vision. Read more here. But, we simply want to be able to secure the right space and not have to go searching for funds once we do. 

Every funded dollar will go into:

  • Securing a lease with deposits and security. 
  • Licensing and permit filing.
  • Some marketing and social media
  • Preparing our investment plan and legal fees. 

The impact and why you should contribute.

  • You'll be helping two really nice guys create something special and see their dream become reality.
  • You'll be helping another small business thrive.
  • You'll be helping us create jobs. We plan on hiring a staff of at least 50.
  • You'll be helping our community find a place to call home, feel like a part of a family while creating lasting relationships.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Even if you can't contribute dollars, you can still help. Please help us spread the word by sharing with you friends and social media accounts. We need the traffic to make this a successful campaign. 
  • It's simple just use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Dig into your six degrees of separation. If you know anyone who may be interested in being a partner or investor, let us know or direct them to this link https://www.zoomerscabaret.com/investor-opportunities

And that's all there is to it.

story:
------------------------------------------------ English -------------------------------------------------

Rent My Apart® is an apartment next to Disneyland Paris with services as a 4 stars hotel.

Looking for a shopping weekend, a stay with your family at Disneyland resort Paris or a temporary rental for a professional need, Rent My Apart will offers solutions tailored to your needs.

Rent for a night, a weekend or a week a fully furnished and equipped apartment 

Located at 30 minutes from city center of Paris (car or subway), the apartment can easily accept up to 4 persons comfortably. 

For the shopping addict: discover a selection of major brands at la Vallée Village Shopping Outlet or at Val d'Europe mall located closed to the residence. 

Packages available:

  • Classic: Accomodation in the apartment 
  • Comfort: Accommodation  with breakfasts & TWO tickets 1Day/2Parks for Disneyland Paris included **
  • Premium: Accommodation with breakfasts + TWO tickets 2Days/2Parks for Disneyland Paris included ** + a 50 € gift voucher at la Vallée Village + a welcome gift + transfers by car with driver from the Orly and Roissy Charles de Gaulle airport or from Marne la Vallée Chessy train station (from 5 nights)

                            ** =  with extra for more Disney tickets


The concierge Rent My Apart offers a customized service with some activities: ticketing (Disneyland, Spa Aquatonic...), booking restaurants & taxi, chef at home ...  

"Little extras"of Rent My Apart: 

  • Personalized welcome
  • Free wifi
  • Concierge service 
  • A gift offer for a stay on Premium package
  • Espresso machine & capsules
  • Smart tv 
  • Queen size bed in the bedroom
  • Tourist brochure
  • International newspapers 
  • Universal adapter
  • ...

My personal experience:

After years of experience in tourism, events and luxury hotels I would like to create Rent My Apart. I speak French, English and Spanish, so I could welcome international customers

What about funding ?

The funds will be used to buy an apartment and equip it in order to offer high quality services. 

For 100 000 $ :

Why invest in this project? What are your benefits?

By choosing perks with nights, you pre-book your stay now!

The launch of Rent My Apart is scheduled for 2016. A booking calendar will be established exclusively for you for any bookings between 2016 and 2019.


                                      ---    MORE PERKS FROM 150 000 $   ---


                                                                ✨ ✨ ✨ 

For more informations, do not hesitate to contact me: 

contact@rentmyapart.com

Thank you for you support !

See you soon

Marie-Laure 

                                                        

                                                


                                                 Disneyland Resort Paris 

www.disneylandparis.fr

                                                       Val d'Europe shopping mall   

 www.valdeurope.fr

                                             La Vallée Village Chic outlet shopping

www.lavalleevillage.com                                             

                                                                        Paris

------------------------------------------------ Français ------------------------------------------------

Rent My Apart® c'est la location d'un appartement à proximité de Disneyland Paris vous offrant des prestations de qualité similaires à celles d'un hôtel 4*.

A la recherche d'un week-end shopping en amoureux, d'un séjour en famille à Disneyland ou d'une location temporaire pour un besoin professionnel, Rent My Apart vous offrira des solutions sur mesure adaptées à vos besoins. 

Louez le temps d'une nuit, d'un week-end ou d'une semaine un appartement de  standing entièrement équipé. 

A seulement 30 minutes du centre de Paris, en voiture ou en transports, avec un accès facile et rapide à la gare de Serris, l'hébergement pourra accueillir jusqu'à 4 personnes. 

Pour les accro du shopping: découvrez une sélection de grandes marques à la Vallée Village Shopping Outlet ou au centre commercial Val d'Europe situés à deux pas de la résidence. 

Plusieurs forfaits seront proposés:

  • Classic: Logement seul 
  • Confort: Logement avec les petits déjeuners & DEUX billets Disney 1Jour/2Parcs inclus **
  • Premium: Logement avec les petits déjeuners & DEUX billets Disney 2Jours/2Parcs** inclus + un bon d'achat de 50 € à la Vallée Village + un cadeau de bienvenue + les transferts en voiture avec chauffeur depuis les aéroports d'Orly, de Roissy ou depuis la gare de Marne la Vallée Chessy (forfait disponible à partir de 5 nuits) 

** =  (avec supplément pour tout billet Disney supplémentaire).


La conciergerie Rent My Apart vous proposera un service sur mesure avec un large choix d'activités: Billetterie (Disneyland, Spa Aquatonic, visites touristiques...), réservation de restaurants et de taxis, chef à domicile ...  

Les "petits plus" Rent My Apart: 

  • Accueil personnalisé
  • Wifi gratuit
  • Service de conciergerie 
  • Cadeau de bienvenue pour toute réservation en Premium
  • Cafetière dernière génération avec capsules
  • Tv connectée 
  • Lit queen size dans la chambre 
  • Brochures touristiques
  • Journaux internationaux 
  • Des adaptateurs universel
  • ...

Mon expérience personnelle:

Mes années d'expérience dans le milieu du tourisme et de l'hôtellerie ainsi que mon anglais et mon espagnol courant me permettront d'accueillir et renseigner au mieux une clientèle internationale.        

A quoi serviront les fonds ?

Les fonds récoltés serviront à acheter un appartement correspondant aux attentes de la marque ainsi qu'aux travaux nécessaires pour l'équiper totalement et répondre donc aux prestations haut de gamme proposés.  

Pour 100 000 $ récoltés, voici comment les fonds seront répartis:

Pourquoi investir dans ce projet ? Quels sont vos avantages?

En investissement dans ce projet, vous participez d'abord au développement d'une entreprise jeune et dynamique.  

En choisissant les contreparties avec nuitées, vous pré-réservez dès à présent votre séjour! 

Le lancement de Rent My Apart est prévu pour le courant de l'année 2016, dès lors un calendrier de réservations sera mis en place en exclusivité pour les donateurs pour toute réservation entre 2016 et 2019 .


                --- DE NOUVELLES CONTREPARTIES À PARTIR DE 150 000 $ ---

                

                                                                        ✨ ✨ ✨ 

Pour plus d'informations n'hésitez pas à me contacter: 

contact@rentmyapart.com 

Merci à tous de votre soutien ! 

A bientôt      

Marie-Laure

story:
Short Summary

UNITEDRSC strives to create a family-friendly, encouraging and fun skateboarding environment where skaters would have healthy competition, highlight local companies, skate parks, and skaters.

  • The #mdskateleague is a  skateboarding contest series where skaters of all skill levels are encouraged to compete in Maryland.
  • We really need a sound system this year so that we are able to pump some music as well as narrate the skate contests without yelling.


Details

  • We are hoping to raise $1500 towards a new sound system and supplies


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford a T-Shirt:

  • Come out and skate at a contest!!
  • Come out and show support at a contest!!
  • Feel Free to share the link with all your friends.  (Thank you)

story: Hi! My name is Amanda Baker. I am a 10 year veteran of the US Army and single mother of two. My partner. Curt Messer, served in the Army for 28 years and works as a photographer. We are heavily involved in the local community. We both work with the Veterans Museum, where I am a trustee. I also volunteer with the Hinton Hope Foundation which seeks to support arts and educational opportunities in our area. Hinton, WV is rebuilding and reinventing itself after years of decline in the local economy, which was dependent on the railroad and coal jobs. Our small town is full of artists, musicians, bakers, and craftsmen and we will give them a space to share their talents and reach for their dreams through new opportunities outside of declining industries. We will offer vendor spaces to allow home businesses and individuals access to the commerce on the main street in the city. There are also plans for a coffee cafe and studios to be available for music and art lessons. The town currently has nowhere for children to take lessons and I believe opportunities for creative expression is a cornerstone for community growth and positive change. This campaign will help us get our building ready to host vendors and shoppers. We need to cover rent and utilities while we work on renovations as well as the cost of business licensure and registration. This town and its people have my whole heart and I want to help revive it and them. I want to inspire and bring hope back. Please consider donating to our cause and sharing the campaign with others who share the values of art, music, and opportunities for self-sufficiency. Every bit helps us move closer to our dream, thank you.

story: Hanging Cloud hand makes all their products and believes in the uniqueness of a persons fashion style. Owners Justyne and Randy have native american roots and would love to help those in need, especially our native family. We plan on donating all misprint clothing/mess up products to homeless shelters and native american tribes. We also plan to donate 5% of our yearly revenue toward charity. With your donations we are looking to purchase a T-shirt press and materials with $2000 which will open new opportunities for us. $1000 will go toward building our website and online store. The last $500 will go to taxes and fees. We also plan to start an endorsement program for artists to be able to promote themselves and even sell their art on our website. We want to help struggling artist to grow along with us by networking together and making beautiful art for a sad world.

story:
Who We Are

Hugo Novelo began collecting art in 2009 and has since acquired over 600 unique pieces, with a large amount of the artists being Omaha natives. His love for the Omaha art community compelled him to open Hugo’s Art Galleries in 2014 with the goal of providing a safe haven for artists of all forms. Artists who partner with the gallery have the opportunity to have their work featured in an art show, published on our website, and promoted through our social media pages. We are 100% artist run and commissioned based, meaning our only income comes from artist sales and donations. Our art shows have no cover charge, and there is no overhead fee to host a show.  Supporting our campaign means supporting your local art community!

What We Need & What You Get

We have a flexible goal of $6,000 with this campaign. All donations will aid in keeping the gallery and our social media pages running, whether we reach our end goal or not. Our team has sat down and created a killer list of perks and merchandise for this campaign and we are ready to send you a little piece of the gallery!

Since our art shows are completely free to attend and participate in, we do everything in our power to push artist sales. We want our artists to have an awesome show and get their work out there! We currently have an operating cost of $500-$600 a month which is primarily coming out of Hugo's pocket. The cost breakdown is listed down below:

  • Rent
  • Utilities
  • Internet Service
  • Storage Fee’s
  • Gas and Travel
  • Wine and Beverages
  • Cheese Trays and Cookie Trays
  • Refreshment Presentation Costs
  • Professional Videography
  • Professional Photography
  • Printing and Reproduction Costs
  • Show Advertisement Costs
  • Social Media Advertisement Costs
  • Website Hosting and Maintenance
  • General Staffing Costs

Other Ways You Can Help

One of the best ways you can help is by promoting our gallery! Bring a friend to the show, interact with our posts on social media, and share our events on Facebook. All of these actions help us grow our presence in the community!

story:
Short Summary

Help us hire the Expendables to solve the Greek crisis.

The concept is simple: we organise a “hit” on the Swiss banks where the Greek Elite of tax-evaders have secured their (stolen from European funds) money, leaving the people of Greece suffer the consequences. We make a stop by Brussels to "solve" things there as well.

Sylvester Stallone, Jason Statham, Schwarzenegger, and the gang, will do much better work solving the Greek crisis than any new austerity package which threatens the basis of democracy. 

We provide you with the best finale to a modern Greek Tragedy. 


Greece Stats

According to Transparency International's Global Corruption Barometer 2013, 90% of surveyed households consider political parties to be corrupt or extremely corrupt—ranking as the most corrupt institution in Greece.

The TTax Justice Network has said that there are over €20 billion in Swiss bank accounts held by Greeks.

At the same time:
The percentage of the population on the verge of poverty or social exclusion increased from 28.1% in 2008 to 35.7% in 2013, while serious deprivation of basic goods increased in the country from 11.2% in 2008 to 20.3% in 2013. 
Also, long-term unemployment in the country rose from 3.7% in 2008 to 18.6% in 2013, while the employment rate of the economically active population (25-64 age group) dropped during that period from 61.9% to 49.3%. 

Where the money goes:

We assume the ballpark of a “hire” for the Expendables services can be at around 125,000 per head (since it is a humanitarian cause).

The team:

Sylvester Stallone

Jason Statham 

Jet Li

Dolph Lundgren

Randy Couture

Terry Crews

Bruce Willys

Mickey Rourke

Steve Austin


The Expendables Agenda

Heist on Swiss banks, “lift” the accounts of tax-evaders, deliver money to associated authority to reduce the greek debt.

Side-targets: 

1. We place a hit on the European policy-makers and Greek politicians in Brussels.

2. We make a stop by Athens, to take out the corrupt hawks of the Greek Parliament who have been clinging on to power for the past three decades.

3. Then we make a stop by the Greek Private tax-evading TV stations and we “solve” them as well.

4. And of course, we take out Sakis Rouvas, the national hero-singer, who propagated shamelessly during the Greek Referendum propaganda in a tv spot of the worst taste.

Greece “solved”. Messy, but not THAT messy...



Who is behind this?

We are individuals who originate from Greece and live abroad and are experiencing the horror of Greece's downhill the past weeks from ground level. Naturally, we are upset, frustrated and worried about our country of origin. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are creating collectible coasters, t-shirts and pins and a "Throw Darts" game with the faces of the brilliant policy makers whom we have to partly thank for the impoverisation of a country, the distabilisation of Eurozone, and the overall mess.

We would use the "Tax-Evaders" as inspiration, but we would perhaps get in trouble.

You get to have a sweet reminder from these turbulent days, up to when you will be 70 and swinging in your rocking chair.


Is this serious?

The Expendables part is not.

This is a campaign which aims to spread some awareness around the topic and shed some humour in the most dark of times for Europe and Greece. It is Fixed Funding campaign which means if it does not reach its unrealistic goal,  Indiegogo will refund all your money, which is 99,999999% possibility. Yup, it is not going to reach its goal.


Sharing is the most important bit.

Help us break the internet with this one. Follow us on Twitter and like our    Facebook page to help spread the word and get the updates. Use the buttons to the left to share on social media.

What if it reaches its goal? What if Stallone really wants to take matters into his own hands?

In case laser unicorns do exist, and the sun gravitates around Earth, this campaign will turn into a crowd funding campaign and will use your support to help Greece and its struggling economy by funding small businesses oriented around the only productive sectors in Greece atm. 

We want to support the the growth of Greece instead of feeding pills to the cripple. Agriculture, artisan businesses, new technologies, the victims of the recent years crisis, need recovery. 

We will team up with extremely “non-corrupt” non profits to achieve that.

And maybe the Expendables might want to chip in anyway.

We can only support all the problems Greece and the constitution of Europe is facing today, by raising awareness on the topic, and supporting Greece anyway that we can.

Every bit counts.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
UPDATE 8/14/2015: This money was never used and will be refunded to the donors. The communities we offered these funds to are very thankful for our generosity, and were able to access the resources they needed via other means. 

Update: Skype call with my colleague Krishna in Nepal and images the team is collecting from the ground

This campaign is to raise funds that my colleagues in Nepal will use to help people who live in their same Kathmandu neighborhoods, while rescuers struggle to find those still trapped under rubble and aid stations deployment is delayed. 

The company I work for has a small software development office in Kathmandu, As head of product, I have been working very closely with the team (Krishna, Saroj, Niroj, Bijay, Subash) there and have gotten to know them personally very well. Just one month ago I was in Nepal to work and spend time with them trekking the Himalayas.

Following Saturday's earthquake in Nepal, I offered to raise funds to send to Krishna and the team for them to use to directly aid the communities they live in, all badly affected by the disaster. 

My colleagues and their immediate families are all physically safe right now. They are now spending their time helping the people in their communities who have been affected more dramatically by the earthquake.

I am creating this campaign to offer them easier, direct access to aid funds. Krishna says that no aid stations have been deployed where he lives, Bhaktapur (a few miles east of central Kathmandu) yet and he cannot feel the evidence of funds committed by foreign organizations or governments. At this time rescue work is done by the local inhabitants and the limited local police force, and water and food in Kathmandu is in limited supply.

Money raised from this campaign will be spent to get more emergency supplies to the people of Kathmandu from other areas of Nepal that were not as affected by the earthquake. (List of items: water, food, emergency medicines, necessity dry goods, blankets, and mattresses to sleep on the floor)

Whatever amount you can give will make a big difference. Also, I know how to send money to Nepal and I will cover transfer costs myself. 

Thanks,
Edo
story_txt:
UPDATE 8/14/2015: This money was never used and will be refunded to the donors. The communities we offered these funds to are very thankful for our generosity, and were able to access the resources they needed via other means.  


Update: Skype call with my colleague Krishna in Nepal and images the team is collecting from the ground

This campaign is to raise funds that my colleagues in Nepal will use to help people who live in their same Kathmandu neighborhoods, while rescuers struggle to find those still trapped under rubble and aid stations deployment is delayed. 

The company I work for has a small software development office in Kathmandu, As head of product, I have been working very closely with the team (Krishna, Saroj, Niroj, Bijay, Subash) there and have gotten to know them personally very well. Just one month ago I was in Nepal to work and spend time with them trekking the Himalayas.Following Saturday's earthquake in Nepal, I offered to raise funds to send to Krishna and the team for them to use to directly aid the communities they live in, all badly affected by the disaster. My colleagues and their immediate families are all physically safe right now. They are now spending their time helping the people in their communities who have been affected more dramatically by the earthquake.I am creating this campaign to offer them easier, direct access to aid funds. Krishna says that no aid stations have been deployed where he lives, Bhaktapur (a few miles east of central Kathmandu) yet and he cannot feel the evidence of funds committed by foreign organizations or governments. At this time rescue work is done by the local inhabitants and the limited local police force, and water and food in Kathmandu is in limited supply.

Money raised from this campaign will be spent to get more emergency supplies to the people of Kathmandu from other areas of Nepal that were not as affected by the earthquake. (List of items: water, food, emergency medicines, necessity dry goods, blankets, and mattresses to sleep on the floor)

Whatever amount you can give will make a big difference. Also, I know how to send money to Nepal and I will cover transfer costs myself. 
Thanks,Edo

story:
CrowdFunding a bailout fund for Greece. 
By the people, for the people.
€1 bn is what the Greeks need. It might seem like a lot but it's only just over €2-3 from each European. 
And remember : this critical hours, which all face up to the stature of our history , our only fear is fear. We will not let him beat us. We will make it. The dignity of the Greeks against the extortion and wrong, will send a message of hope and pride throughout Europe


Let's just get Greece sorted

The European Union is home to 500 million people, we can get Greece sorted and hopefully get them back on track soon. 

What We Need & What You Get

You help Greece ! nothing more ! 

Is that really all it would take?

We promise that all profits will go to the Greek people

FAQs and Press/Media


Who are you?

I'm 42 years old and from Athens, I currently work in my magic shop but i cant save Greece by magic 

Is this a joke?

No. I can understand why people might take it as a joke, but Crowdfunding can really help because it's just a case of getting on and doing it.


Do you have any link to IndieGoGo?

I've never been involved with IndieGoGo before. 

What happens if you don’t make the target?

All the money is refunded. Hopefully we’ll make it though!


Do you think Europeans are generous enough?

Europeans are pretty generous on the whole, 

What will happen to the money?

We promise that all profits will go to the Greek people. Whether that be via the government accepting it or by other means.

How can the Greek government accept your money?

That's one for IndieGoGo to help me with! 

Do you think that you can reach the target?

I hope very much that the campaign will reach the target,

story:
Short Summary

When bees draw comb naturally they fill all available areas of their hive until the space in the hive has been used. The combs are often curved and interlocked. This makes it impossible to easily inspect the hives for disease or harvest excess honey without causing severe damage to the comb and frequently killing bees which in turn limits honey production. CombForms™ works with the bees natural instincts to guide them to produce uniform, straight combs. The forms were designed to provide the right size, shape and spacing. The hexagonal holes and use of "bee space" communicates with honeybees in a language they understand. The initial trials with CombForms™ show we can guide bees where to build and sometimes more importantly where not to build their comb.

Hive cut away image from CombForms™ provisional patent application


Using 3D printing of prototypes has allowed for preliminary trials and modifications. It is now time for larger scale testing. The purpose of this crowd funding campaign is to produce a short run of 10,000 CombForms™ by injection molding using food-safe strong and flexible nylon. 


What We Need & What You Get

This campaign will allow a short run of 10,000 CombForms™ to be produced. This includes the production costs such as mold design, tool & die manufacture of the injection mold, overhead, Indiegogo and other fees as well as shipping and handling of 1,400 sets of seven CombForms™ per set as perks. By using CombForms™ as perks for experienced beekeepers, we hope to get independent testing as well as feedback. 

Each contribution of $60 will result in a set of seven CombForms™ to be shipped as a perk within the United States (International shipment of perks is extra). In order for this project to succeed we must raise a minimum of $65,000. 

This campaign has a strict deadline! This means that all contributions must be made through PayPal. You can use your own PayPal account or a credit card. Your contribution will be processed and the money held by PayPal until our campaign's deadline. If we do not reach our goal, PayPal promises to refund all contributions within 3-5 business days of the campaign's deadline.

We are counting on this project funding and moving forward according to the following schedule:

June 15, 2015 - Indiegogo Crowd Funding Campaign begins.

August 14, 2015 - Indiegogo Campaign closes. Injection Mold Design & Manufacture begins.

October 2015 - CombForm™ Fabrication.

November 2015 - Final shipment of perks. It is our goal to have the first 1,400 sets of CombForms™ perks in beekeepers hands so they can be used to test overwintering hives in many areas in the Northern Hemisphere. This time-frame will hopefully allow some production season testing in the Southern Hemisphere to begin in the 2015 season.

By contributing you are accepting some risks - we are required to notify you that we will make a best effort to provide the reward but delivery is not guaranteed. We do not anticipate it, but unanticipated delays may also occur.


 Overages

In the event this Indiegogo campaign exceeds $65,000 the overage may be used for a variety of projects to provide further testing and help bring CombForms™ to market as well as continue our own research and development.
The initial run of CombForms™ will be sized to fit Langstroth Deep Hives. If there is an overage we will be evaluating what other size CombForms™ we should offer. It is possible for you to cut CombForms™ down to fit some other types of hives such as Langstroth medium or shallow hives, Warre, and Top Bar Hives; however, It would be far better for us to be able to manufacture a variety of sizes since trimming CombForms™ would weaken them by having to cut through the reinforcing structure. If there is an overage, then additional sizes would be evaluated on a case by case basis to determine if there is sufficient interest to warrant the manufacture of those other sizes.

More About the Use of CombForms™

When bees draw comb naturally they fill all available areas of their hive until the space in the hive has been used. The combs are often curved and interlocked. This makes it impossible to easily inspect the hives for disease or harvest excess honey without causing severe damage to the comb and frequently killing quantities of bees. Although there are many variations on the beehive, all modern types of hives used throughout the world for bee culture have removable frames. Many beekeepers provide beeswax or artificial foundation which acts as a template for the cell pattern and cell base construction of wax comb in frames. CombForms™ are constructed so that bees are encouraged to construct wax in the frames into straight even combs with or without the use of foundation. They allow the workers, queen and drones to move through the hexagonal opening to other parts of the hive.

Relative size of hexagon openings (queen - top, worker - left, drone - right) from CombForms™ provisional patent application


Brood comb for raising new generations of bees is typically uniform in depth; whereas, honeycomb is frequently either over or under-built. Whenever one frame of honeycomb is overbuilt, it protrudes or bulges into the adjoining frame resulting in the adjacent frame being under-built, thin and convex or curved and locked into the next frame or even missing. Although not as severe a problem as curved comb, over-built and under-built comb can also result in frames being locked together. These irregularities on honeycomb may require repeated trimming until the comb irregularities have been reduced and the adjoining thin or missing frames of comb have been filled with a balanced amount of comb that completely fills the frame. When beekeepers have to deal with misshapen or irregular comb it requires extra time for trimming and can interfere or slow down the honey harvest by requiring extra labor for uncapping the under-built sections of the comb by hand. Trimming the over-built sections of the comb to the proper size means that the removed sections will require extra handling to separate the honey from the wax. After trimming the adjacent frame will have a void or under-built area of wax. The bees may continue to over-build the one side instead of completing the under -built area. CombForms™ guides the bees to fill the entire frame and helps establish the space between combs which is used by bees to move about the hive. Once this spacing is established the CombForm™ can be removed for use elsewhere and after sliding the frames together the bees do not construct additional comb into this "bee space".

When beekeepers allow hived bees to construct their comb without the use of foundation as a template they typically use a starter strip at the top of the frame for the bees to begin their comb construction. In order to begin the construction of comb in an open cavity the bees will join together in an interlocking group that hangs from the top of the hive in a festoon. Combs constructed this way are quickly built - but the bees will sometimes deviate from the starter strip and build crooked combs. In a worst case scenario the bees will build cross comb which is perpendicular to the direction desired by the beekeeper. This effectively locks the frames together so that separating the frames can substantially damage the comb and may consequently kill many bees. Constructing comb is an energy intensive activity with the bees having to use substantial amounts of carbohydrates in the form of nectar or supplied sugar water to make the wax. It has been reported that production of one pound of beeswax requires at least eight pounds of honey. This means that when the beekeeper must remove misshapen comb there will be a loss of honey since the bees will have to reconstruct the missing comb instead of having the excess honey available for storage. Using CombForms™ can mean the bees waste less energy on false starts that end up having to be destroyed by the beekeeper.


Six possible methods of using CombForms™


Past Inventions Leading to CombForms™ 

CombForms™ has benefited from a study of the designs and practices of historical methods.


In his 1873 patent David Latchaw wrote:

As a means of causing the bees to build comb with regularity, and to confine them to one frame til they have nearly or quite filled it, the guide R may be advantageously applied between the comb-frames. It is formed of muslin or other similar fabric, dipped in melted bees-wax. It has apertures like the wire gauze plate P, to permit the bees to pass through from one frame to the other, and support themselves during the commencement of the comb-building. When the comb has been commenced the plate R may be removed.


When bees experience overcrowding within the hive they will respond by swarming. This is the natural way that honeybee colonies reproduce. Approximately half the bees in the hive will leave the hive along with the existing queen bee. This relieves the overcrowding and is the way that bees propagate new hives. When apiary hives swarm it results in a reduction in the amount of honey that can be harvested. The bees put their energy into making a new hive instead of producing honey. Recapturing the swarm is additional work for the beekeeper and may result in the swarm invading a populated area causing people to panic. There is a delicate balance that must be achieved by beekeepers that hope to harvest surplus honey from their bees. Strong hives are necessary to bring in enough nectar to make extra honey that can be harvested, but strong hives are more likely to swarm due to overcrowding of the brood box.

Lewis Aspinwall - 1908 Swarm Prevention Frame, Patent Number 891,584

In 1897 Lewis Agustus Aspinwall patented a method of making bees feel like they had adequate room so they would focus their attention on honey production instead of swarming. Aspinwall's principle encouraged the bees to expand their hive upward into the empty honey supers that were place on top of the hive. 

In my present hive I employ similar brood or comb frames, and I prefer to arrange the same alternately with dummy frames that are filled in with a series of similar or parallel strips or slats. These slats may be placed in any desired direction and so close to one another as to leave between them about a bee-space, and the slats are preferably as wide as the dummy frames, and they are so close as to prevent the bees building comb in the frames, but yet at the same time allowing room for the bees to travel through the dummy frames from one comb frame to the next and in this way providing ample room for all the bees and for the increase of the bees, so as to overcome the tendency of the bees to swarm at certain periods.

Placing three CombForms™ side-by-side at the edge of the brood ball creates the appropriate spacing and is hypothesized as another way to utilize the Aspinwall method for swarm prevention. Preliminary testing appears favorable; however, controlled trials supported by this crowd funding project are needed.  


How You Can Help With Our Research

Shortly after we begin shipping CombForms™ as perks, we intend to add to our web-site a number of Crowd Science Projects to ask your help to figure out best practices. We fully expect that some ways of using CombForms™ may end up sending bees the wrong message. By participating in our Crowd Source research project we hope to learn even more about communicating our desires to the bees and understanding when the bees tell us Yes and No!

This section of our web-site and the research project proposal synopsis are under development, but you can help us right now by going to the Research section of our website www.combforms.com and letting us know your thoughts on what types of Combforms™ questions you would like to see studied.


FAQs

How Can I Order A Set Of CombForms™?

Right now, the only way to get CombForms™ is through our Indiegogo page. People who contribute to the project on Indiegogo, will get the first CombForms's as perks.

When Will I Receive My Perk?

When you make your contributions it is time stamped by Indiegogo. Your perk will be shipped on a first come, first served basis. This means that the first backers will get their CombForms™ perk first, according to when the orders were received. We anticipate that we may get some perks out by the end of October but some of the first fourteen hundred orders will ship at the beginning of November 2015. If more than fourteen hundred persons contribute those perks may take longer - but will continue to be shipped in order. Approximate shipping date information will also be posted on our web-site at www.combforms.com.

How do I know CombForms™ will work?

CombForms™ are a new tool based on past beekeeping methods. You should think of them as being in Beta testing. Although the results using CombForms™ has been favorable - their testing continues. Honeybee management practices vary and each hive has its own personality. Results using CombForms™ may vary. Users of CombForms™ do so at their own risk. If you are using CombForms™ it is important you monitor your hives to be sure it's working and communicating the message you intend to the bees. Additional information about using CombForms™ can be found on our website. We also encourage you to share your experiences on our blog. 


What If I Have a Problem With My Order?

Just go to the top right of the Indiegogo page and click on "Your Name" and "Contact User".  This is how you notify us about changes to your orders, such as address changes. If your problem requires Indiegogo or PayPal involvement we will send you to their customer service.

Please be aware that PayPal has certain limits on the amount of money that you can send. If you're paying as a guest in PayPal, you will not be able to contribute more than $500 (USD). You will also only be able to use PayPal's guest checkout process up to 15 times with a total spending limit of $4,000. Once you reach PayPal's maximum, you will be prompted to upgrade to a full PayPal account.

How Do I Get Help Or Support?

Send us a message on our contact page we will work with you to take care of your issue!

What Is The Cost For Shipping?

Shipping perks within the United States is included with your $60  contribution. International shipments of perks to most parts of the world will require a contribution of $75. If you are not in the European Union, Canada, Mexico, Australia or New Zealand please check with us regarding shipping costs first by sending us a message. International contributors will also need to pay any customs, taxes and other fees required by their country.

Has CombForms™ been Patented?

CombForms™ is patent pending and trademarked.

What CombForms™ Made Out Of?

CombForms will be made of Food safe BPA and phthalate free nylon.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please let people know about this campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools so you will be able to find out about updates.
  • Follow us at our blog at www.combforms.com
