story:
About Heather:

Heather is a 28 year old ambitious and aspiring entrepreneur living in the heart of Nashville.  She is planning to open a floatation therapy center.  Flotation therapy is a very unique business that will bring many benefits to the Nashville community. 

Heather spent the last six years working in the corporate world for a large telecommunications company.  While working for this company, she relocated multiple times, but is now lucky to be back with her family and loved ones in Middle Tennessee.  While climbing the corporate ladder was never on her personal agenda, she was very successful in her field.  Over the last six years, she worked in six locations spanned across three states, and was the General Manager of three locations- consistently leading a team of 20 plus direct reports.  She credits her success to her personal drive, work ethic, dedication to those around her, ability to build strong relationships, and surrounding herself with strong mentors.  The experience and knowledge that she accumulated while working in the corporate world is something that can never be taken from her, and she believes it will be invaluable in terms of her start up success. 

In early 2015, Heather was currently working around 60 hours per week in a high stress job, and she began reading about the benefits that floating could have on stress and fatigue.  The benefits did not stop there.  The more research that she did, the more intrigued she was.  The tank had so many health benefits, and she was baffled that most of the general public had a limited awareness of floatation therapy.  As someone who spent the previous year in and out of the offices of neurologists, seeking a possible diagnosis of Relapsing- Remitting Multiple Sclerosis, some of the benefits sounded too good to be true.  She decided to book a session at a local float club that was just opening in her current city of Naperville, IL. The experience was like nothing she had ever experienced before, and she was an immediate advocate of floating.  She immediately signed up for a membership that gave her four floats per month, and she was able to share these with friends and family.  Heather carried this membership for the duration of her residency in IL, and also persuaded 10-20 people in her life to try out the service.  Sometimes, she would get push back at the beginning, but as a true saleswoman, she was able to sell them on trying one of her free membership floats.  Every single person was blown away by their experience, and many of those went on to open their own monthly memberships. 

Who can benefit from floatation therapy?

  • Athletes

  • Anyone that has a stressful schedule, or that suffers from fatigue

  • Those in chronic pain, or those who are dealing with minor to significant health issues

  • Individuals that are interested in meditation and creativity

What are some benefits backed by science and research?

Heather encourages everyone to go out and do their own research on the many benefits of floatation therapy, but to save you some time; she has broken down for us what she believes are the most predominant benefits studied and publicized.

  • Promotes relaxation, reduces fatigue, improves insomnia, decreases stress and depression, provides mental clarity, increases motivation, helps with phobias and addictions, and promotes energy. 1 hour in the float tank is equivalent to 4 hours of your deepest sleep.

  • Stimulates creativity, awareness, learning, alertness, and problem solving by promoting more left brain dominance

  • Decreases Cortisol levels, produces natural endorphins, reduces blood pressure, increases and promotes healthy blood flow, improves athletic performance, speeds up the body’s natural healing process, reduces inflammation, replenishes magnesium in the body, relieves chronic pain, and improves immune function. The elimination of chronic pain can last up to 48 hours after the initial float is over.

Recent spotlight and influential people who use floatation therapy:

  • United States Navy Seals

  • Seattle Seahawks

  • UFC fighters

  • Indianapolis Colts

  • The US and Australian Olympic teams

  • The Patriots

  • The Philadelphia Eagles and Phillies both had tanks installed in their training facilities during the 1980’s.

  • Entertainers: Jim Carey, Jeff Bridges, and Joe Rogan who is one of the industry’s biggest advocates.

  • Nobel Prize winners, influential doctors and many other great minds of our time.

  • In most recent news, ESPN did a special last month on Stephen Curry and Harrison Barnes.  In this special they explain their floatation routines and the benefits it is having on their athletic careers.

What will the funding be used for?

  • The most expensive investment for this start up will be the float rooms themselves.  Heather plans to have 4 float rooms and/or pods, each costing a minimum of $20,000.

  • The rest of the funds will be used to secure a location and lease, to have any build-out of the location done that is needed, materials needed to keep the tanks running safely and efficiently, initial utilities, interior design that is relaxing and inviting, and lastly Heather plans to get some legal advice to ensure she is navigating the world of entrepreneurship legally and effectively.

What plans have already been put into motion by Heather?

  • Secured business name, website domain, and business email address

  • Narrowed down the business location, with a strong interest in the music row area

  • Jennifer Litsey, who Heather met at work several years ago, is assisting Heather in creating her brand logo, website design, and marketing.  Jennifer received a degree in graphic design, and decided a couple years ago to leave her secure job in pursuits of a larger dream.  She is now a full time missionary, living in Hawaii, and is heavily involved with the organization Youth With A Mission.

  • Full business plan is developed- including costs, overhead, hours, rates, and ROI

How does Heather plan to give back to the Nashville community?

  • Heather will be donating 15% of all profits on a yearly basis to charities or organizations that are close to her heart.  To ensure this is secured, Heather is having 15% of all incoming revenue set aside into a trust account that will pay out yearly to these charities.

  1. John A Gupton College

    John A Gupton College is a private school of mortuary science located in Nashville, TN.  It is in the same building as the Tennessee Funeral Directors Association.  It is accredited by the Commission on Colleges of the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools, and the American Board of Funeral Service Education.  Heather is a Gupton Alumni, and graduated from the private school in 2009.

  2. St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital

  3. Hands on Nashville

  4. American Red Cross- Nashville Chapter

  5. Still narrowing down my last choice :)

Final Thoughts:

This dream began close to a year ago, when Heather had her first float experience.  That first experience was in Naperville, IL, at Anicca Float Club.  The owners of the float center, Lindsay Reinhardt and Paul Feyer, have been one of the largest sources of knowledge and motivation for Heather to move forward with this dream.  They run their business with passion and drive, and have given Heather an example of the type of business she wants to own.  They have given her practical advice throughout this process, while also being a voice of inspiration.  Heather says that these two individuals, who are entrepreneurs turned into friends, inspired her to take risks and follow her dreams all while making the world a better place.  Heather hopes that she will one day be able to impact members of the Nashville community in this same way.  Below you will find a link to Heather’s personal favorite float center, Anicca Float club, and also a video link of Lindsay explaining the benefits of flotation therapy. 

www.floatnaperville.com

https://youtu.be/GMHhwh_0zTk
story_txt:
About Heather:
Heather is a 28 year old ambitious
and aspiring entrepreneur living in the heart of Nashville.  She is planning to open a floatation therapy
center.  Flotation therapy is a very
unique business that will bring many benefits to the Nashville community.  
Heather spent the last six years
working in the corporate world for a large telecommunications company.  While working for this company, she relocated
multiple times, but is now lucky to be back with her family and loved ones in
Middle Tennessee.  While climbing the corporate ladder was never
on her personal agenda, she was very successful in her field.  Over the last six years, she worked in six locations
spanned across three states, and was the General Manager of three locations- consistently
leading a team of 20 plus direct reports. 
She credits her success to her personal drive, work ethic, dedication to
those around her, ability to build strong relationships, and surrounding
herself with strong mentors.  The
experience and knowledge that she accumulated while working in the corporate world
is something that can never be taken from her, and she believes it will be
invaluable in terms of her start up success. 

In early 2015, Heather was
currently working around 60 hours per week in a high stress job, and she began
reading about the benefits that floating could have on stress and fatigue.  The benefits did not stop there.  The more research that she did, the more
intrigued she was.  The tank had so many
health benefits, and she was baffled that most of the general public had a limited
awareness of floatation therapy.  As
someone who spent the previous year in and out of the offices of neurologists,
seeking a possible diagnosis of Relapsing- Remitting Multiple Sclerosis, some of
the benefits sounded too good to be true. 
She decided to book a session at a local float club that was just
opening in her current city of Naperville, IL. The experience was like nothing she had ever
experienced before, and she was an immediate advocate of floating.  She immediately signed up for a membership
that gave her four floats per month, and she was able to share these with friends
and family.  Heather carried this membership
for the duration of her residency in IL, and also persuaded 10-20 people in her
life to try out the service.  Sometimes,
she would get push back at the beginning, but as a true saleswoman, she was
able to sell them on trying one of her free membership floats.  Every single person was blown away by their
experience, and many of those went on to open their own monthly memberships.  
Who can benefit from
floatation therapy?
Athletes

Anyone that has a stressful schedule, or that
suffers from fatigue
Those in chronic pain, or those who are dealing
with minor to significant health issues
Individuals that are interested in meditation
and creativity

What are some benefits
backed by science and research?
Heather encourages
everyone to go out and do their own research on the many benefits of floatation
therapy, but to save you some time; she has broken down for us what she
believes are the most predominant benefits studied and publicized.

Promotes relaxation, reduces fatigue, improves
insomnia, decreases stress and depression, provides mental clarity, increases
motivation, helps with phobias and addictions, and promotes energy. 1 hour in the float tank is equivalent to 4
hours of your deepest sleep.
Stimulates creativity, awareness, learning, alertness,
and problem solving by promoting more left brain dominance
Decreases Cortisol levels, produces natural endorphins,
reduces blood pressure, increases and promotes healthy blood flow, improves
athletic performance, speeds up the body’s natural healing process, reduces inflammation,
replenishes magnesium in the body, relieves chronic pain, and improves immune function.
The
elimination of chronic pain can last up to 48 hours after the initial float is
over.

Recent spotlight and
influential people who use floatation therapy:

United States Navy Seals
Seattle Seahawks
UFC fighters
Indianapolis Colts
The US and Australian Olympic teams
The Patriots
The Philadelphia Eagles and Phillies both
had tanks installed in their training facilities during the 1980’s.
Entertainers: Jim Carey, Jeff Bridges, and Joe
Rogan who is one of the industry’s biggest advocates.
Nobel Prize winners, influential doctors and
many other great minds of our time.
In most recent news, ESPN did a special last
month on Stephen Curry and Harrison Barnes. 
In this special they explain their floatation routines and the benefits it
is having on their athletic careers.

What will the funding
be used for?

The most expensive investment for this start up
will be the float rooms themselves. 
Heather plans to have 4 float rooms and/or pods, each costing a minimum of
$20,000.
The rest of the funds will be used to secure a
location and lease, to have any build-out of the location done that is needed,
materials needed to keep the tanks running safely and efficiently, initial
utilities, interior design that is relaxing and inviting, and lastly Heather
plans to get some legal advice to ensure she is navigating the world of
entrepreneurship legally and effectively.

business email address

strong interest in the music row area

years ago, is assisting Heather in creating her brand logo, website design, and
marketing.  Jennifer received a degree in
graphic design, and decided a couple years ago to leave her secure job in
pursuits of a larger dream.  She is now a
full time missionary, living in Hawaii, and is heavily involved with the
organization Youth With A Mission.

costs, overhead, hours, rates, and ROI

to give back to the Nashville community?
Heather will be donating 15% of all profits on a
yearly basis to charities or organizations that are close to her heart.  To ensure this is secured, Heather is having
15% of all incoming revenue set aside into a trust account that will pay out

story:
Help us raise $20,000 for start up costs.


The money will be used toward:

  • Down payment on a building
  • Rental equipment (guns and safety gear)
  • Field setup (blockades and structures)
  • Security system
  • WiFi setup
  • Furniture


Why should I donate?

You will be helping raise awareness and expand the network of airsoft players. 

(Yeah, that's nice and all, but what do I get out of it?)

Oh, don't you worry. We've got you covered, too. Check out all the Perks for donating.


What happens if you don't reach goal?

We're glass half full guys here, but if we don't reach our goal then all donations will be fully refunded and no prizes given out. Boo! Let's hope it doesn't get to that.


Where can I learn more about Mad Wolf Airsoft?

Currently we have a Facebook page: http://www.facebook.com/MadWolfAirsoft/
You can also reach out to us at: mwairsoftarena@gmail.com

story:
The Yardin Pot

Grow better, eat better, live better... with the Yardin Pot

This is a Fixed Funding campaign. Upon choosing your perk, your payment will be processed immediately, but you will receive a refund if the campaign does not reach its funding goal. You will be redirected to PayPal where you can pay with your credit card or PayPal account. Thank you for your support!

Why the need for the Yardin Pot:

I've been using raised garden beds for years, but as I get older, the amount of work it takes to maintain them is getting harder. I wanted to enjoy my garden again and that's when I had the idea for the Yardin Pot. Because using the Yardin Pot requires minimal maintenance and virtually no weeding, I now have the garden I want and the time to enjoy it.

Everybody wants a beautifully landscaped yard and the benefits of fresh and healthy homegrown food without the tedious work of weeding or the loosing their yard to a large garden.  The Yardin Pot can be used in lawns, boulevards, rock gardens and more. With it's unique design, the Yardin Pot utilizes the natural in-ground ecosystem, fits a standard tomato cage and virtually eliminates the need for weeding!

American made and manufactured to the highest quality with non-volatile plastic. This ensures you get the best product we can make. The Yardin Pot is made with UV resistant materials to make sure the vibrant colors last for years.

Using the Yardin Pot is as easy as digging a hole, back-filling, inserting the Yardin Pot and using augmented (or original soil). Voila - your garden is ready for planting!  Think of the money you'll save over putting in raised garden beds!



The above-ground portion of the Yardin Pot provides provides insulation for new seeds or plants and protection against lawn maintenance activities such as weed whipping.  The below ground portion protects your plants from weed infiltration and allow the roots to access the naturally rich ecosystem.

The Yardin Pot is aesthetically appealing in design and color in order to compliment your existing landscape design.   The Yardin Pot will be offered in three colors to start, with plans to expand color selection as demand reflects.


The Yardin Pot works great in existing gardens to contain herbs and plants in their respective locations....




or to add a decorative pop of color to flower garden designs...


or in townhouse landscaping to reclaim underutilized space for growing your own fresh vegetables and herbs.




The unique combination of form and function in the Yardin Pot is a welcome addition to first time and seasoned gardeners.  With sunshine and a small amount of soil, you too can grow your own healthy food or add a distinctive look to your property that will have the neighborhood talking!

Our campaign is needed to raise the funds necessary to get production off the ground and hope that you will support us in our efforts to reignite a passion for home gardening and all the health benefits associated with it.



You'll save money and time by using the Yardin Pot. Imagine a beautiful garden that's easy to maintain... Enjoy your garden, don't work your garden!

What We Need & What You Get

We require funding for the tooling required to manufacture.
  • The product requires tooling for a plastic injection molding die.  The complex die is made of hardened steel and requires skilled engineering and design, special materials, machinery and highly trained personnel to manufacture, assemble and test.  This cost estimate is $50,000 for this portion of the process.


  • After the die is tooled, the injection molding process can begin.  Molton plastic material is forced into the mold cavity under high pressure.  The cost for materials and labor of this process is estimated at $30,000.
  • Once we raise these funds, the Yardin Pot will be placed into production with a 12-18 week manufacturing lead time.
  • Funding our campaign will guarantee your purchase of the first manufacturing run with the quantity and color selection available.  The anticipated ship date for this first manufacturing run is March of 2017.


    The Yardin Pot Impact

    This product allows you to plant vegetation in just about any area while protecting it and utilizing the available ecosystem and environment efficiently. 

    The container is placed partially in the ground allowing the inclusion of native and/or conditioned soil for the planting of the vegetation.  The open bottom and side wall openings allow the vegetation to access the microbial life and earthworms and ensures adequate drainage.  The sidewalls are deep enough to prevent most weed infiltration virtually eliminating the need to weed! 

    • Grow your own fresh produce in unlimited areas:  lawns, rock gardens, landscaped areas, existing gardens, etc.
    • Virtually eliminate weeding and minimize watering.
    • Utilize the existing in-ground eco-system.
    • Efficiently utilize irrigation by directing water source directly to the plant.
    • Protect your plant from required lawn maintenance activities.


    Risks & Challenges

    The Yardin Pot product requires a capital investment for tooling design and material and labor costs of first manufacture run.   

    • Our design has been fine tuned to minimize tooling efficiency and shipping costs. 
    • US Patent Pending 62/338,788


    Other Ways You Can Help Yardin Systems

    If you can see the benefit in increasing independent food production but don't have the need for the product, consider sponsoring us by:

    • Donating the product for a church garden ministry
    • Use in community garden co-ops
    • Tell someone else that would benefit from self produced food
    • Share the product with your friends, family and neighbors

    Thank you for your support!


    *Currently available only in the continental United States

gardens, etc.

Utilize the existing in-ground eco-system.

Protect your plant from required lawn maintenance activities.

 If you can see the benefit in increasing independent food production but don't have the need for the product, consider sponsoring us by:  Donating the product for a church garden ministry

Share the product with your friends, family and neighbors

story:
The Shred, Revolutionized

Have you ever wanted to fly like a super hero?  Well, now's your chance.  Help us bring the Flyboard to Ohio.  Why should only vacation spots have all the cool stuff?  If you don’t already know about Flyboarding, please take a moment to watch the video.  Words alone, cannot describe this sport.

We are James Mikel and Rhonda Everitt, husband/wife team, owners of Shred Revolution, LLC.  As long-time entrepreneurs, we know it's important to do market research to see if there is interest in a product.  If you watched the video and got excited about trying the Flyboard, this is your next Everest and we want to be your Tenzing Norgay (translation Sherpa Guide) as we travel to the exotic lakes and bodies of water in our beloved Ohio. Standing on a tube of water 30 ft in the air may feel like 30,000ft.  Sound exciting?  Then we are asking for your help.  If you can’t wait to get in the water and learn to fly, please pre-pay for all or part of your flight package to help us get this business off the ground.  


I Shred, therefore, I Am

I, Rhonda, am a multi-store franchisee with Planet Smoothie in the Dayton/Cincy area.  I am also a Group Fitness instructor teaching Aqua Fitness and cardio + strength classes.  In 2002, I nearly lost my leg in a traumatic motorcycle accident.  Even while on crutches (it was for 4 1/2 years--I had to do something), I got my Open Water Diving Certification.  I found strength and empowerment in being in the water and it was a huge step forward in my recovery to master something new. 

I, James, am the owner of Bridge Software Technologies, a custom software developer for manufacturing. I seem to always find something extreme to try.  I broke the ball off the top of my humorous bone in 2011 learning to race Super Bikes on a closed circuit track.  Though my shoulder still challenges me, I have since learned to ocean surf, and hit jumps in the terrain park while snowboarding.  

Together, we have helped our six kids learn to kneeboard, wakeboard, wake surf, and snowboard.  We have also spent years helping many to learn flowboarding--which is not an easy skill for most.  Though we have completely different teaching methods (Rhonda’s is 84% success rate for flowboarding), one of us will have you up and flying in no time.  


Money, money, money, mo-ney

In all, we need about 20k to get started:

  • Personal Watercraft with trailer and cover
  • Flyboard
  • Liability Insurance 
  • Life Jackets and Helmets
  • Advertising/Marketing flyers
  • GoPro Cameras and accessories
  • Flyboard Instructor Training, Ohio Boating Safety, CPR and first aid certification  

So, why are we asking for so little? 

If we can generate $7500.00 or more worth of interest through this campaign, we believe it will be a viable and thriving business.  We truly need to know that this is something other people want to do, and do again.  So, by pre-paying for your flight, or one for someone else, you will help us know that this project is worth doing.  You’ll also be one of the first in the area to experience this exciting sport.  Our perks will give you great deals on future flights, and more.  The size of your savings increases with the size of your perk.  These are only for those of you who have helped us get started. But don't limit yourself to just one perk.  You can have as many perks as you are willing to pay for. You have to do each as a separate transaction, but grab as many as you would like. (More may be added throughout the campaign).

This campaign is all,or nothing. 

Rider Requirements:

  • Riders must be at least 15 years old and a parent or guardian must sign a waiver on behalf of the minor.  Photo ID required
  • Riders must be between 100-260 pounds 
  • You must come to our Area of Operation--currently most of Ohio
  • Flyboard needs approx 12 feet of depth to operate

To Shred, or not to Shred…there is no question

Some call us crazy, but trying a new challenge and succeeding—even a little, and even if it’s not pretty, can be very encouraging.  We have done many things we never thought possible and want to help others realize what they are capable of, as well.  You may not see yourself as a “dare devil”, but Flyboarding could be a place to begin.  It’s easy to get started, is low impact and low risk.   

We are ready for a new challenge.  This is a totally different business model than what we are used to--this model is mobile--but proven to work--just look at the Food Truck industry.  You can come to us at Caesar's Creek, ( and maybe Brookville Lake) or we can come to a lake or river near you.   Follow us on Facebook to see where we will be heading next and book your flight right from our page.   Even though it can be an extreme sport, nearly anyone can learn how to do it.  Please join with us to get people all over Ohio flying high.  Maybe you'll even find the super hero inside of you.


Other Ways You Can Help

The $7500 will basically get things rolling.  We will still need to find plenty of riders this season to cover all the expenses. So, please share this campaign and our FB page with others on social media. Thank you

     required
Riders must be between 100-260 pounds 
You must come to our Area of Operation--currently most of Ohio
Flyboard needs approx 12 feet of depth to operate

To Shred, or not to
Shred…there is no question
Some call us crazy, but trying a new
challenge and succeeding—even a little, and even if it’s not pretty, can be
very encouraging.  We have done many
things we never thought possible and want to help others realize what they are
capable of, as well.  You may not see
yourself as a “dare devil”, but Flyboarding could be a place to begin.  It’s easy to get started, is low impact and
low risk.   
We are ready for a new challenge.  This is a totally different business model than what we are used to--this model is mobile--but proven to work--just look at the Food Truck industry.  You can come to us at Caesar's Creek, ( and maybe Brookville Lake) or we can come to a lake or river near you.   Follow us on Facebook to see where we will be heading next and book your flight right from our page.   Even though it can be an extreme sport, nearly anyone can learn how to do it.  Please join with us to get people all over Ohio flying high.  Maybe you'll even find the super hero inside of you.



Other Ways You Can Help
The $7500 will
basically get things rolling.  We will still need to find plenty of riders
this season to cover all the expenses. So, please share
this campaign and our FB page with others on social media. Thank you

story:
It doesn't snow in Oakland


 Everyone calls me "Snook". For the past dozen years I have been running an industrial creative space called NIMBY. Where good people can use shared tools and space to build their dreams or help others build theirs. But that's a whole other story. please see www.NIMBYspace.org.

In the past we have always relied on the generosity of performers and musicians to put on a show and raise money for the space and other projects. This time lets let the gear heads and good hearted raise some fun. I want to fix up this old truck and deliver Christmas trees and pumpkins to those that can't get out to get their own. It's a crazy thought I have had for years and it needs to happen at least once. Maybe a hay ride in a local parade. We don't get snow in Oakland and so many good folks don't get to celebrate the holidays because they can't get out or other expenses are more important.

I believe this neighborhood needs a little pick me up. This dream allows for everyone to get involved if they want to and get to know their neighbors. With an old classic truck slowly rumbling around bringing smiles to everyone. Maybe I'm crazy. Let's do it and see what happens.

So this fabulous old truck has been sitting in my yard for about 8 years because I have this idea. Last month we rebuilt the carburetor and oiled her up and she runs like the work horse she was meant to be. I have a bunch of talented volunteers at my disposal so I know we can get her up to speed with out the usual labor costs.

She's going to need some better shoes; I should be able to find some good used tires and wheels for about $500.00
She has to be able to stop.  New wheel cylinders and a two stage master cylinder
maybe new seals. I'm figuring the shoes and drums are OK say $600.00
We will need to drop the fuel tank and clean and seal it or possibly replace it. Say $300.00
Change all fluids and hoses. Keep in mind this is a 1950 motor so there's about three hoses. The radiator holds water now but is starting to seep so we will probably need a rebuild it. All of that should come to $600.00
We should hammer out the dent in the drivers door and fix the running board. Maybe replace a cracked window. Say another $500
The rest of the money will go to CA reg and Insurance as well as those little unexpected things like U joints or pizza and beer.
If there's not enough interest. You loose nothing and I will sell this truck "as is" this summer to someone that will restore it. The proceeds will go back to NIMBY for storing the truck all these years. If we actually make the goal we will make deals with local pumpkin patches and tree lots to deliver trees. I have purposely aimed low on this ask to make it happen. If we exceed our ask then maybe we can give some trees and pumpkins away for discount or make additional repair so that this project remains sustainable.

story:
This page was created to provide access to Union Member to donate to our organizational efforts in NY state to Fund the Apprenticeship program, We need to Start very soon. We have over 1200 Members employment applications that are  ready to enter the vetting process so that we can provide a Completely Vetted and Medical accredited and Trained employee to the potential employers by July 15th in 5 Location across the by a state. This is a State Accredited Program. We have the backing of the AFL-CIO, NY Department of State, The NY CWA 1122 President. 

All We ask is All Union Employees to do is donate $1.00 to this Union orgizanational effort in NY State

story:
Good afternoon, I’m writing this letter because two years ago I decided to create a veterinary post called “Posta Una Esperanza (post one Hope)” with the finality of helping animals of poor families who can’t pay the high costs of common veterinaries, also we help street animals which the majority of times are rescue for people who don’t have enough resources.

The veterinary is located in “San Juan de Lurigancho” which is the most populated district in Perú; this district has more than one million people, also it has a large population of homeless animals without any kind of help and families who have pets but they don’t have enough money for pay the high veterinary services.

Our plan is to combat animal population (cats and dogs) because the majority of this animals are abandoned, maltreated and suffering in the streets. 

The sterilization surgery has a very low cost; it is 30 soles (10 dollars). In these last two years we have sterilized more than 10 thousand patients, of which more than the 20% was free. As you can see, we provide this kind of service to the low-income community and to the animals; unfortunately, we can’t go ahead with our job because a lot of our resources are not enough.Can you help us to move on?We do not have resources to renew our surgical instruments. We do not have resources to renew our surgery room.We don’t have enough resources to acquire the equipment that we need.Every day we take care of many cases of animals with fractures, gastric outlet obstruction , tumors, cancer, among other ailments , unfortunately we can’t take care of them properly. The cost of x-ray services and ultrasound in another veterinary is very high for this reason people can’t access to these services. We ask the help of all of you to make this veterinary project go ahead.  What we need : X -ray equipment -  price $ 10,000 Ultrasound equipment - price $ 6000 Vital Signs Monitor – Price 500 dollars Instruments for surgery room – Price 2 thousand dollars


Hola, hace 2 años decidí abrir la veterinaria “Posta Una Esperanza” con la finalidad de ayudar a los animales de  las familias pobres que no pueden pagar los elevados costos de las veterinarias comunes y también ayudar a los animales de la calle que muchas veces son rescatados por personas que no tienen recursos.

Estamos Ubicados en el distrito de San Juan de Lurigancho es el distrito mas poblado de Perú ya que cuenta con 1 millón de habitantes y también hay una amplia población de animales menores sin ayuda, abandonados, y familias que no tienen dinero para acceder a servicios veterinarios ya que el costo es elevado. 

Nuestro plan es combatir la sobre población  de animales (perros y gatos) ya que muchos terminan abandonados, maltratados y sufriendo en las calles.

La cirugía de esterilización tiene un costo muy bajo de 30 soles (10 dolares) durante estos 2 años hemos esterilizado un promedio de más de 10 mil pacientes de los cuales más del 20% fue de manera gratuita.

Como podrán apreciar brindar este servicibeneficia a la comunidad de escasos recursos y también a los animales, lamentablemente nuestro trabajo no puede seguir adelante ya que nuestros recursos son insuficientes.

Puedes ayudarnos a seguir adelante?

No tenemos recursos para renovar instrumental quirúrgico.

No tenemos recursos para renovar nuestra sala de cirugía.

No tenemos recursos para adquirir los equipos que necesitamos.

Cada día atendemos diversos casos de animales con fracturas, obstrucción gástrica, tumores, cáncer, entre otros males,  lamentablemente no podemos atenderlos adecuadamente.

El costo de los servicios de rayos x y ecografía en otras clínicas veterinarias es muy elevado lo cual hace que las personas no puedan acceder a estos servicios.

Pedimos la ayuda de todos ustedes para que este proyecto de veterinaria pueda seguir adelante.

Necesitamos:

Equipo de Rayos x  precio 10 mil dólares

Equipo de ecografía precio 6 mil dólares

Monitor de signos vitales 500 dolares

Instrumental para sala de cirugía 2 mil dolares

story:
What If...?

What if we can create diamonds for $10 per carat. What if we can use molds to create diamonds in any shape and size. What if...?

The Idea

I am developing a new method of synthesizing diamonds. Imagine taking a powder and turning it into a diamond in a few hours, with total costs of only ten dollars per carat. Any size, any shape.

The Idea

A few years ago I was doing theoretical work with adamantane (the smallest molecule with the same chemical structure as diamond). I developed a method to align the molecules and realized that I was just a few short steps from making diamonds. Looking at diamond's structure with this in mind, I found that adamantane was not suitable (left gaps), but aligned diadamantane plus two parts of methane fit perfectly.

Diadamantane is commercially available as a powder thus it can be poured into a mold before conversion to diamond. With the material components aligned, the energy required for the creation of diamonds should be much lower than current methods. Exactly how much lower is one of the things this experiment is going to determine.

The Plan

Build a specialized oven (crucible), make diamonds. Sounds simple right? The oven itself should be fairly simple but the experimental process, that is another matter entirely. With eleven different variables to test at high, middle, and low values there is a lot of testing to do. Twenty three initial settings. Evaluate the results and try differing combinations until the limits of the 1st iteration crucible are reached. Study the results and use that data to build the second iteration crucible. Repeat. Each trial will be run three times and will consist of five samples of approximately three carats each. Once conversion is achieved samples will be sent out to the AGS laboratories for quality assessment and certification. My funding goal will provide enough money to build three iterations of the crucible, with a little extra to cover unexpected costs. Progress updates will be made at every stage.

The Breakdown

$100,000 (goal)

$12,000 crucible structure
$12,000 crucible electronics
$2,000 material ingredients
$4,000 testing and certification

Total for 1st iteration $30,000
2nd iteration $30,000
3rd iteration $30,000

Total for construction and testing $90,000
$10,000 for unforseen expenses

The Rewards
$3 Inclusion in patent
Your name included on a contributors page addendum to the patent.
$10 Diadamantane
You receive a pen containing one carat weight of diadamantane powder in a capsule.
$30 Failed diamond
You receive a pen containing one carat weight of unconverted powder in a capsule.
$100 1 ct diamond
You receive a one carat man-made PDS diamond.
$300 3 ct diamond
You receive a three carat man-made PDS diamond.
$1,000 "Penny Diamond"
You receive a US penny encased in a single five carat man-made PDS diamond with certification included.
$3,000 5 ct diamond
You receive a custom PDS diamond of up to five carats (one third of a cubic centimeter) with certification included.
$10,000 15 ct diamond
You receive a custom PDS diamond of up to fifteen carats (one cubic centimeter) with certification included.
$30,000 50 ct diamond
You receive a custom PDS diamond of up to fifty carats (three cubic centimeters) with certification included.
$100,000 150 ct diamond
You receive a custom PDS diamond of up to one hundred and fifty carats (ten cubic centimeters) with certification included.
$300,000 "Doomstar" Diamond
You receive a "Doomstar" Diamond made using a 1.5 inch diameter mold, or other custom PDS diamond of up to four hundred and fifty  carats (thirty cubic centimeters) with certification included
Diamonds
Diamonds are the hardest substance known to humankind, they can be used in optics, electronics, cutting tools, jewelry, and more things that haven't even been created yet. 
The synthetic diamond industry nets roughly 1.5 billion dollars per year. Most are used for 'industrial' purposes although synthetic jewelry is becoming more common.
I have been planning this for a few years now. I have identified the components required for conversion. I have identified the variables, and designed an experiment to test them singly and together. Inexpensive man-made diamonds can be a reality. I have done the theoretical work, but that is as far as I can go on my own. I need your help to bring this the rest of the way.

Risks & Challenges

This is an experiment. It should work, but I may be wrong. The testing plan is designed to maximize the chance of success.

I am an unknown individual. I cannot provide character references. My name is not attached to any scientific research. I do not have a college degree. I was a chemical engineering student and I do know my chemistry. I am willing to work hard. I will see this through to the end.

Should the experiments fail to produce diamonds, any funding levels beyond my capabilities will be rewarded with carat equivalents of the highest level achieved.


You may feel that the risks are just too high to contribute your money, I am okay with that. However, if you think this is cool, neat, or even awesome... please, tell people about it.

story:
MONITOR: 14 to 16 sensors will monitor every aspect of your hive's health, population and stores.  The cloud app will send you an alarm when something needs your attention.  See what's going on in other hives from around the world so you can prepare in advance...

CONTROLLER: Capacity to control up to 6 different plug-ins (fans, heaters, valves, servos, etc...)  Is like having another you taking care of your bees 24/7.

GUARDIAN: Designed to keep predators like hornets, moths and mice out and let bees enter and exit freely. Designed for Langstroth hive can easily be adapted to fit almost any hive system.


Short Summary

Hi, I’m Mario, an Environmental Engineer and a Beekeeper.  For the last 20 years, I’ve been battling: pollution, global warming, deforestation and extinction.  So if you think your job stinks, think of me working on top of a Wastewater treatment plant holding the raw sewer of a whole city!

Today, Bees are endangered, so we decided to tackle this problem head on… to do this we developed The Hive Genie.


The Hive Genie is a Robotic beekeeper, Pest Management System,  a Guardian and an Information Center all in one Bee friendly unit.  Our patent pending technology can actually tell apart between incoming and outgoing bees. Temperature, humidity, foraging activity, weight and light are all measured constantly. 

Information is sent to the cloud were you can have a graphic view of your hives.  If something is wrong in the hive, you can get customizable alerts on your mobile.  By detecting problems in their early stages the chances of succeeding are way higher.

The Hive Genie will save you: time, work, money and could save your bees!

  By opting to share your hive's info, valuable data can be gathered to pinpoint the causes of Colony Collapse Disorder and save the bees.




Even so, in the last decade, the world has lost about 40% of its bee population.  Which is twice above the normal loses.  


OUR STORY; A BEEKEEPERS GAUNTLET

My family and I love honey, but we couldn’t find the good quality, pure, raw, organic honey that would make us happy. Being a family of doers, we decided to do it ourselves and went into beekeeping putting our best foot forward by acquiring three hives. 

Our hard work and tender loving care were not enough and we ended up loosing all of them.  It was a hard, and very sad way to learn that the more information you gather from your hive, the better equipped you are to succeed as a beekeeper.  

But properly monitoring the hives is easier said than done; it’s time consuming work with the bonus of a few stings.  And learning about bees takes a long time.

Open the hives too frequently and you disturb the bees too much; leave them by themselves too long and they may swarm on you, costing most of your honey and half of your bees.


Or like it happened to us, you come to see them a day too late and figure out that you could have saved them from drowning or moths had you checked them earlier.   

SOLUTION

Today, we enjoy our bees and our quasi organic honey (hard to say organic 100%, you never know where the bees forage from, but we do our part!).  And we want to make the beekeeping experience simple and enjoyable for everybody so more people can have bees.  Also, we want to save the bees but we need tons of information to find the causes of Colony Collapse Disorder.


After three years of design work and testing, we have developed the Hive Genie. 



BENEFITS

When a problem is detected the HIVE GENIE suggests an inspection and in some cases a solution.  The on board LED will let you know when something is wrong and what to do. 

In the cloud application you can have a graphic display of your different hives, add notes and compare them to other hives from around the world.


Monitor the effect of specific pesticides and monoculture crops in real time.

Know when to add another supper or when to harvest your honey. 

Have a graphic view of the honey flow in each of your hives.  Know when to start and stop feeding or if it is necessary at all.

See how your bees are handling the cold winters and hot summers, and get alerted if they need assistance.  Detect when your hive is sick or under attack, especially at night.

Make sure your queen is laying and get population estimates.

Know when you can split your hive and get alerted when they are about to swarm.


FEATURES

The gates sizes have been tailored to protect the bees from hornets, mice and moths while letting the bees enter and exit freely, even during the peak of the honey flow.  


TECHNOLOGY

The Hive Genie is Arduino based, which means it is proven and reliable open source technology.  It also means that can be hacked with and expanded with many people’s inventions.


OPTIONAL ADD ONs, STRETCH GOALS

The Hive Genie has connectors for future optional actuators that can be installed in the hive such as: cameras, microphones, heaters, fans, infrared motion detectors, automated skylights, beetle traps and powder sugar sprinklers. 

Since we've talked to a lot of beekeepers from around the world, we have a pretty good feeling for what add-ons and plug ins we should do.  So as we pass our campaign goal, we will start to develop some of these add-ons. 


You can connect and control your Flow Hive from the HIVE GENIE! (Stretch Goal check our store at www.HiveGenie.com for other possible future add-ons).  These is a concept for the Flow Hive valve.  Still very rough though!


INSTALLATION

The HIVE GENIE is easy to install: simply slide the unit in your hive entrance, introduce the temperature and humidity probe and position the weight sensors underneath it and you are done! 


ADVANTAGES

Researchers and Commercial beekeepers may monitor hundreds of hives in a matter of seconds.   As few as 5 to 10% of your hives monitored with the Hive Genie can give a solid statistical sampling of your entire apiary.


Backyard beekeepers can enjoy the hive all day long and know what’s happening even if you are a beginner.

Take care of your bees while on vacation!

The Hive Genie makes beekeeping easier on beginners and experts alike.  And it’s easier on the bees too. 

Get your HIVE GENIE and enjoy your bees. Now, you will only have to open the hive for the right reasons.

It’s like BIG BROTHER for your hive!

Hive Genie is like the R2 unit of the hive.


COMMUNITY

Environmental problems are solvable.  In the past, humanity has saved the whales from extinction, stopped the ozone layer depletion, and re-mediated polluted areas. Every day more people have access to vaccines and potable water.   Now, let’s save the bees! 

By installing Hive Genies across the globe and sharing the information gathered we know we can save the bees! Help us save the bees, starting with your own!  The information we can collect with your Hive Genies is invaluable to researchers.  Our little friends deserve our help.

The Hive Genie will save you: time, work, money and could save your bees!

So spread the word and join us.

To make the HIVE GENIE readily available at super cool prices, we need your support so we can make production runs that are cost effective.  Make a pledge or donation  and help us make the HIVE GENIE a reality. 

Make sure to select the HIVE GENIE that is right for you.  


NOTE:  As you can see we decided to remove the LCD so we could add some more sensing capabilities.  All visual info will be available on the cloud and via a color code in the Hive Genie's only LED.  This thing looks more and more like R2!  But in doesn't whistle.

You can count on HIVE GENIE to count your bees!  BEE HAPPY!

8. Hi Mario,

Quick question for you, please.

First, by way of background:

  I started keeping bees in 1968.

  Bees are a big part of my life…I have my hands on active beehives 5 or more days a week and I am always researching, or otherwise involved with bees, such as public speaking on bee topics.

  I believe tech innovations are (and will be) very important to the future of beekeeping.

  I invest heavily in tech innovations related to bee health and beekeeping.

  I participate in online/crowdfunding of beekeeping innovations.

  I have viewed your indiegogo video.

  I sincerely wish you the best with this and other beekeeping innovations.

  I hope my comments here will not be a cause of discouragement.

Because you reached out to me via email prior to your indiegogo campaign and again with this promo update, I am inquiring specifically of you.

My concern (and then my question)

A.  In my experience, bees need a lot of unrestricted access to their hive. By the way, for at least 8 months of the year, my hives all have top entrances as well as bottom entrances. In fact, I would say that most of my bees only ever enter at the top, rather than via the bottom board.  Bees—in my experience--just prefer it that way, whether beekeepers ever know it or not.  In any event, in most of the beekeeping I have ever been involved with, the bees (during most of the year) need a lot of ingress and egress, AND the ability to ventilate the cavity. 

B.  My concern, with respect to your system: if bees are constricted in their ingress and egress to a few slots on a bottom board, how would they be able to cure/desiccate their honey, control humidity levels in the brood area, ensure adequate oxygen supply and how would the traffic congestion impact the hive.  Sorry to say: I am confident that if I were to constrict any of my colonies to the limited apertures provided in your device, they would either perish from overheating or they would swarm because their hive box would be unmanageable due to overheat, excessive humidity and lack of oxygen.  Alternatively, I question whether any hive small enough that it could survive with such a constricted entrance/exit would be worth owning, from an economic perspective.

So my sincere question is:  Setting aside a “reduced entrance” management practice for wintertime in cold climates, how could any beekeeper have a viable hive with such a small entrance?  In other words: Where is there a beekeeper who could actually use the system proposed in your Indiegogo campaign?

Thanks in advance for considering my question…I sincerely do not mean to be disrespectful.

With kind regards,

Thank you a lot for your feedback I do appreciate it a lot.  To be perfectly honest, that was one of my concerns too ( in fact a major one ) and we have a few solutions for this, so please continue reading. 

1.  I have talked to many researchers like Dr. Rangel from UT and Dr. Lilia De Guzman from the USDA ARS and none of them have this concern. 

2.  Even so, I still have the same concern as you.  I have personally tested the Hive Genie in my hives with no adverse consequences, although I do confess the tests were from August to October.  So no real heat issues.  I’m still concerned about this so what I’m doing now is that we are testing new sensors that do not require entrance restriction.  But keep reading… 

3.  Also, we have already developed an entrance block that permits ventilation.  Look at our store at www.hivegenie.com

4.  According to Thomas D. Seeley in his book Honey Bee democracy bees actually prefer smaller entrances and only one is needed. They do prefer it at the bottom.

5.  The Practical beekeeper author also point this, although he mentions he prefers top entrances… but Thomas D Seeley is the world’s leading bee authority. 

6.  Either way, the Hive Genie could be retrofitted to use top entrances.

7.  Remember that temp and RH will be measured constantly and if that would cause a problem you would be alerted…

8.  Now, what I do know for a fact is that moist air is heavier than dry air, so the air will actually exit through the screen bottom board of the hive, while new air enters from the top (yes, we may or should develop some sort of vent…)

9.  Also, reduced entrances are easier to defend from robbers, intruders and make it somewhat more difficult for hive beetles to enter.

10.  Most wild colonies or those found in houses have very tiny entrances.

11.  A reduced entrance is better for bees because temperature will not change as fast, which is better for brood.

12.  Bees tolerate a lot of heat, in fact their preferred temp of 34 Celsius is a hot temperature, so in general cold is the enemy, not heat.

13.  Hot air evaporates more water, so temperature regulation gets easier for bees as air approaches their goal temp.

14.  Warre hives, Japanese traditional hives and many other have bottom only entrances.

15.  I’ve always had bottom only entrances with no problems… but I do use screen bottom boards…

So yes, I do have screen bottom boards, I do have the same concern as you but there are many solutions to this problem.  My pledge to you is that if regardless of this project becoming funded, we will continue testing to get this concern off our minds.  I include myself again with you.  I personally tried to include (and perhaps will) more entrances but at the time we were concerned about pricing, but perhaps we should add more entrances.  I do agree

So I guess what I’m trying to say is that part of the experience of crowdfunding is getting valuable feedback such as yours.  Honestly, you are the first beekeeper other than me, that expresses this concern (others may have it but not express it)  I will think of a way to include a solution before the campaign is over.

And as I state in my campaign timeline and budget, there is still going to be another engineering round before the final product is launched.  And I assure you we will solve this potential problem…

Thanks again for your interest in Hive Genie


1. So How Powerful does the Hive Genie really is?  There are a lot of claims of what it can do.


To put things in perspective lets compare Hive Genie with some famous computers:

The AGC (Apollo Guidance Computer) which was the computer in the command module of NASA's Apollo missions and helped astronauts to control the module's navigation path to the Moon and back, had 64 Kbytes of memory and operated at a speed of 0.043 MHz.

The Hive Genie has 32 Kbytes of Program memory but operates at 16 MHz.  So this means that the Hive Genie runs 372 times faster than the Apollo Guidance Computer, but has only half the memory for programming.  That's OK though, we are not flying to the moon, we are only relaying information to the cloud and controlling a few add ons!  Plenty of power.  The rest of the program is on the cloud where we can interpret all the data gathered and trigger alarms.  In some ironic twist, our "Mission Control" is on the cloud!  Fascinating times we live in!  

Photos courtesy of NASA, Top: Apollo Mission Take Off.  Bottom, Apollo Guidance Computer that was in the Command Module.


2. Mario I've just read your web page - Quite a lot of claims but I figure presently you only monitor-

1.  Bees going in and out - numbers. How does it know internal hive numbers?

2.  Hive weight with a probe under the Box on one edge?

3.  Ambient Temp inside and out side the hive - temperature probe

4.  Ambient Light - light sensor

5.  How does it tell you what the Queen is laying? Does it come equipped with a camera?

6.  How does it know about infestations? Is there a way or means of detecting foreign invaders?

7.  Does it detect and understand the hive pheromones?

What specifically does it presently actually measure?
I understand you have used open source and that others can then use your code to "Add On" functions, apps etc and the possibilities are "endless"
Is it wireless.
Does it require a phone chip?
How do you access the cloud, does it do Android/ Apple or OS only?

More information would be useful

It has WiFi.  if you don't have WiFi signal in your hive, you can buy a router in Amazon for $30 USD that can solve this problem and use the cell phone network to connect to the cloud.

It is an Arduino based microcontroller.  We have engineered in such a way as to leave 3 to 6 pins for output, that is control things...  I will now answer your questions in order:

1, About counting bees.  Let's assume that you have 30,000 foragers in your hive (which is typical average), so in the morning, 30,000 bees will go out, the counter counts how many bees go out, as they complete their rounds, some will come back and exit again.  So the number of bees out will be changing over time, but at the end of the day only three things can happen:  The number of bees that came back is less than the ones that left.  This is the normal thing, you expect to loose around 1000 bees at the honey flow per day.  Your Queen can lay more than 1900 eggs a day so you are fine.  If you loose say 5000 a day, you can safely assume that some pesticide is killing your bees.  Your Queen won't be able to keep up you may loose your hive in as little as 5 to 10 days!  And perhaps call it CCD!

The other thing that can happen but would be rare, is that the exact number of bees that exited came back in.

The third thing would be you get 20,000 bees more into your hive, therefore africanization.  Now, if the activity doubles and the weight decreases, then you are being robbed.  If all the bees are going out and no bee is coming in, then your bees are about to swarm.   You have may be a couple of hours to catch them.  Hive Genie will let you know within minutes of any of these things happening!

2. Weight is measured by a probe under the front end of the hive and we just double the weight.  It is a rough estimate but the trend is what you need.  Over time with your personal feedback you can figure out a correction factor.

3. Yes temp probe inside and out and the same probe can measure relative Humidity.

4. Ambient light detector is important so if you have a lot of nocturnal activity, then moths may be coming in or your bees are under attack by a skunk or something like it.

5. OK, to determine if the Queen is laying we keep the count.  Let's say 30,000 bees exited yesterday and 29,000 came back.  If today another 30,000 exit, then you can assume that the Queen is laying at least enough to replace the death toll.  On the contrary if 29,000 go out today, and tomorrow 28,000 and so on, you may have no Queen.  Also, when the Queen is laying, the temperature is pretty stable at around 33-34 ºC and if there is no Queen, temp inside the hive will vary throughout the day.

So counting bees bidirectionally actually tells a very good story of what is going on inside and outside of your hive!

About the camera:  SORRY it does not for two reasons:

A. The image signal takes a lot of space in the controller so we wouldn't be able to count or weigh bees, which in my mind are the two most important pieces of information.  A camera only tells you what is going on in the parts you can see, as weight and count tell you the whole story, even about foraging dangers.  Also, the camera can only tell what you personally see, as where with numbers you the software can trigger alarms 24/7

B. A camera and servos to move it would cost as much as a GoPro, in which case you just go and buy a GoPro or a surveillance system.

I am not saying that a camera is not a good idea, but for now it is not a priority.  Maybe if lots of beeks ask we can develop something in the near future.

6. I think this is explained above.  The fact that all the alarms are on the cloud means that as we gather more info we can fine tune and correlate more things...

7. Currently it does not have a nose; maybe in the future we can find a sensor that detects this!  Exciting isn't it?

Actually with our prototypes we can measure:

Bees bidirectionally

Temp and humidity

Weight

Light intensity

So we tested all this and we are refining the alarm system triggers as we learn more.  Since our alarm system will be on the cloud, we can constantly fine tune it and develop new alarms when enough data reveals more correlations to other events.

Hope this info is useful, will be glad to answer more questions...
story_txt:
MONITOR: 14 to 16 sensors will monitor every aspect of your hive's health, population and stores.  The cloud app will send you an alarm when something needs your attention.  See what's going on in other hives from around the world so you can prepare in advance...


CONTROLLER: Capacity to control up to 6 different plug-ins (fans, heaters, valves, servos, etc...)  Is like having another you taking care of your bees 24/7.


GUARDIAN: Designed to keep predators like hornets, moths and mice out and let bees enter and exit freely. Designed for Langstroth hive can easily be adapted to fit almost any hive system.



Short Summary 

Hi, I’m Mario,
an Environmental Engineer and a Beekeeper. 
For the last 20 years, I’ve been battling: pollution, global warming, deforestation and extinction.  So if you think your job stinks, think of me working on top of a Wastewater treatment plant holding the raw sewer of a whole city!
Today, Bees are endangered, so we decided to tackle this problem head on… to do this we developed The Hive Genie.



The Hive Genie is a Robotic beekeeper, Pest Management System,  a Guardian and an Information Center all in one
Bee friendly unit.  Our patent pending technology can actually tell
apart between incoming and outgoing bees. Temperature, humidity, foraging
activity, weight and light are all measured constantly. 
Information is sent to the cloud were you can have a graphic view of your hives.  If something is wrong in the hive, you can get customizable alerts on your mobile.  By detecting problems in their early stages the chances of succeeding are way higher.

The Hive Genie will save you: time, work, money and could save your bees!
  By opting to share your hive's info, valuable data can be gathered to pinpoint the causes of Colony Collapse Disorder and save the bees.







Even so, in the last decade, the world has lost about 40% of
its bee population.  Which
is twice above the normal loses.  



OUR STORY; A BEEKEEPERS GAUNTLET
My family and I love honey, but we couldn’t find the good quality, pure, raw, organic honey that would make us happy. Being a family of doers, we decided to do it ourselves and went into beekeeping putting our best foot forward by acquiring three hives. 
Our hard work and tender loving care were not enough and we ended up loosing all of them.  It was a hard, and very sad way to learn that the more information you gather from your hive, the better equipped you are to succeed as a beekeeper.  
But properly monitoring the hives is easier said than done;
it’s time consuming work with the bonus of a few stings.  And learning about bees takes a long time.
Open the hives too frequently and you disturb the bees too much;
leave them by themselves too long and they may swarm on you, costing most of
your honey and half of your bees.



Or like it happened to us, you come to see them a day too late and figure out that you
could have saved them from drowning or moths had you checked them earlier.   
SOLUTION
Today, we enjoy our bees and our quasi organic honey (hard to say organic 100%, you never know where the bees forage from, but we do our part!).  And we want to make the beekeeping experience
simple and enjoyable for everybody so more people can have bees.  Also, we want to save the bees but we need
tons of information to find the causes of Colony Collapse Disorder.


After three years of design work and testing, we have
developed the Hive Genie. 




BENEFITS
When a problem is detected the HIVE GENIE suggests an
inspection and in some cases a solution.  The on board LED will let you
know when something is wrong and what to do. 
In the cloud application you can have a graphic
display of your different hives, add notes and compare them to other hives from
around the world.



Monitor the effect of specific pesticides and monoculture
crops in real time.
Know when to add another supper or when to harvest your
honey.  
Have a graphic view of the honey flow in each of your
hives.  Know when to start and stop
feeding or if it is necessary at all.
See how your bees are handling the cold winters and hot
summers, and get alerted if they need assistance.  Detect when your hive is sick or under attack,
especially at night.
Make sure your queen is laying and get population estimates.
Know
when you can split your hive and get alerted when they are about to swarm.




FEATURES
The gates sizes have been tailored to protect the bees from
hornets, mice and moths while letting the bees enter and exit freely, even
during the peak of the honey flow.  

TECHNOLOGY
The Hive Genie is Arduino based, which means it is proven
and reliable open source technology.  It
also means that can be hacked with and expanded with many people’s inventions.

OPTIONAL ADD ONs, STRETCH GOALS
The Hive Genie has connectors for future optional actuators that can be
installed in the hive such as: cameras, microphones, heaters, fans, infrared
motion detectors, automated skylights, beetle traps and powder sugar sprinklers.  
Since we've talked to a lot of beekeepers from around the world, we have a pretty good feeling for what add-ons and plug ins we should do.  So as we pass our campaign goal, we will start to develop some of these add-ons. 



You can
connect and control your Flow Hive from the HIVE GENIE! (Stretch Goal check our store at www.HiveGenie.com for other possible future add-ons).  These is a concept for the Flow Hive valve.  Still very rough though!



INSTALLATION
The HIVE GENIE is easy to install: simply slide the unit in
your hive entrance, introduce the temperature and humidity probe and position
the weight sensors underneath it and you are done! 

ADVANTAGES
Researchers and Commercial beekeepers may monitor hundreds
of hives in a matter of seconds.   As few as 5 to 10% of your hives monitored
with the Hive Genie can give a solid statistical sampling of your entire apiary.


Backyard beekeepers can enjoy the hive all day long and know
what’s happening even if you are a beginner.
Take care of your bees while on vacation!
The Hive Genie makes beekeeping easier on beginners and
experts alike.  And it’s easier on the
bees too. 
Get
your HIVE GENIE and enjoy your bees. Now, you will only have to open the hive
for the right reasons.
It’s like
BIG BROTHER for your hive!
Hive Genie is like the R2 unit of the hive.


COMMUNITY

Environmental problems are solvable.  In the past, humanity has saved the whales
from extinction, stopped the ozone layer depletion, and re-mediated polluted
areas. Every
day more people have access to vaccines and potable water.   Now,
let’s save the bees! 
By installing Hive Genies across the globe and sharing the
information gathered we know we can save the bees! Help
us save the bees, starting with your own! 
The information we can collect with your Hive Genies is invaluable to
researchers.  Our little friends deserve our help. 
The Hive Genie will save you: time, work, money and could save your bees!
So spread the word and join us.
To make the HIVE GENIE readily available at super cool
prices, we need your support so we can make production runs that are cost
effective.  Make a pledge or
donation  and help us make the HIVE GENIE
a reality.  
Make
sure to select the HIVE GENIE that is right for you.  




NOTE:  As you can see we decided to remove the LCD so we could add some more sensing capabilities.  All visual info will be available on the cloud and via a color code in the Hive Genie's only LED.  This thing looks more and more like R2!  But in doesn't whistle.




You can count on HIVE GENIE to count your bees!  BEE HAPPY!
